Reviews.Title: “14 days "stuck" at the Sheraton JBW”
Reviews.Author: paulajab
Reviews.Content: We came over for a look see, and were supposed to be in a service apt, but we managed to secure a room for 14 days at the Sheraton on JB walk. We had an absolutely fab time. It definitely is a hot spot for Russian vacationers, but that just made it more interesting for our American family of three. The food is okay, but the restaurant staff is EXCELLENT. Spent quite a bit of time at the internet cafe, and the ladies in there are superb too! We enjoyed the beach, the pool and especially the people watching on the"walk" here at JBR. The Marina mall is close by and loved going to Carluccios on the ground floor. Didn't know if we were going to like Dubai, but we were all pleasantly surprised! I highly recommend this hotel for families on holiday and business travel. I felt safe, and comfortable. The hotel is older, but the beach area is the best on the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scairney1
Reviews.Content: One of Only a couple of hotels actually on the beach. Beach is nice. Resort is clean and staff nice and efficient. Really enjoy Sheraton JBR.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with terrific service”
Reviews.Author: stargazeypie
Reviews.Content: You know wherever you go in the world if you stay at a Sheraton you will be superbly looked after. I've stayed in many Sheratons and you know you will never be let down. However, this trip didn't start very well with the Sheraton taking the full payment on my card a month in advance even though they don't ever even ask for a deposit and you can cancel up to 24hrs before arriving. I discovered this when my credit card statement arrived and contacted them immediately. Not only did they arrance an automatic refund they also paid the interest on my card and the difference in the exchange rates as well as upgrading my room and arranging free airport transfers. The hotel is next to the beach in Jumeirah, and our room had spectacular sea views with Atlantis in the distance. The hotel itself has a wonderful pool and gardens and private beach. Even though it is a fair taxi or metro ride to any of the malls or attractions it is well worth it to be next to the sea rather than just surrounded by skyscrapers, building works and construction which is everywhere. We were fortunate enough to have the Club facilities on the 9th floor which are well worth the extra providing a delicious breakfast in a much quieter location plus drinks and canapes in the evening which is a real treat before you go out to dinner. The Club Lounge also has wifi and computers for the guests' use. We didnt eat in any of the hotel restaurants even though there is a very good choice and all the menus looked delicious. We ate by the pool (excellent) and in the cafe one day, again, very good. The beds are by far the most comfortable of all hotels and the bathrooms are very well equiped with everything you could possibly need. The staff are fantastic in every way. Every request was speedily dealt with and the conceirge desk were brilliant at booking restaurants for us. It's a lovely hotel and if I go back to Dubai I would definitely stay there again and it is tremendous value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice location and grounds”
Reviews.Author: Morholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in aug 2008' great hotel, good class and standars, helpful staff and great buffet breakfast. The hotel ground and access to private beach was great. Enjoy our time here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service + extortionate prices = :-(”
Reviews.Author: daddyshoe
Reviews.Content: I was very much looking forward to my weekend stay after a long business trip. As others noted, the front desk staff were not quite rude but not quite friendly. As a reference, I had just transferred from Le Royal Meridian, which is in essentially the same location. This Sheraton's prices were higher than the Meridian, and the quality was just not there. I actually took the price list from the minibar. $25 for a little tiny bottle of gin. Really? No water or towels in the fitness center? Do yourself a favor and stay at Le Meridian. It's been over 2 weeks since my stay and I cannot overstate how unhappy I am with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...not as per Sheraton standards”
Reviews.Author: shraddha79
Reviews.Content: we had booked 2 rooms, one against SPG points and when we reached at 12, they were not even able to give us one room to freshen up. In the evening when we got back, there was total confusion on the rooms allocated, and was given the wrong room key!!!!! fortunately i didnot enter another persons room!!! We were allocated rooms on a smoking floor (all 4 of us are non smokers) and the rooms smelled of stale smoke. All this was ok, till all the toilet drain clogged and we were stuck waiting for housekeeping to come and clean up the toilets. The rooms are average size and even the TV viewing is mediocre. There was construction work on and though there was zero noise, we did find the entire experience not good. Eating at hotel is not an option, considering there are good cafes all around the hotel. The hotel is old, and LOOKs old too. But now the good bits.. The hotel is located on the JBR walk which is an awesome place to hangout in the evening and walk around - eat at the cafes or shop. There is astarbucks rite opposite the hotel, which is a blessing. But remember the entire road has heavy traffic and be prepared for the taxi guy to drop u in the middle of the road to walk to the hotel....which at times is faster. Not very far from dubai mall, MOE or other places in dubai, so getting back in the middle of the night after partying is not a problem. All in all, the sheraton jumeirah doesnot give you an experience that you would expect from the chain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday we've had”
Reviews.Author: Karen M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a fortnight and could not fault the way we were treated by all of the staff. We arrived early morning after a night flight and didn't have to wait to long to check in our room even though check in is official 3pm. We were offered breakfast while we waited. The hotel is ideally situated on JBR walk where there are plenty of places to eat. Would highly recommend Moods bar staff very attentive also the new Bliss bar in the hotel grounds. Our room was cleaned daily. Read reviews about building going up next door yes you do lose the sun between 12.50 - 13.40 but this is an ideal time to get lunch. The only thing that needs changing is free wifi at all times.

Reviews.Title: “have to take the good with the bad”
Reviews.Author: Basil Q
Reviews.Content: Great Location off JBR for walks at night. Rooms are roomy with maintain quality. Internet speed is adequate. And breakfast is good with variety. Seeing we have a youg daughter, check in personnel took the initiative to secure a room as early as 12:00 ready with a baby cot. Housekeeping is fantastic. Had a few hiccups like keeping the Do not Disturb on all day, and the Guest Service was extremely responsive. They are suffering big with the building under construction next door. Very dusty entrance and parking lot that they have to battle with every morning. Pool unheated. Hard to get quietness and good access to sun rays. The space for breakfast is limited when it peaks at 9:30 Over all 4 Star + and fit for touristic travel with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: keep12
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 3 night of our honeymoon in September 2010 in Dubai before moving to Seychelles, and we stayed at Sheraton Jumeirah Beach. Situated on a very nice beach, with pool (and its inner bar) located in a beautiful palms park that lies between th hotel and the beach. The hotel is on the Marina Walk (full of restaurants, stores, hotels), but if you want to reach the most famous Dubai attractions you should take a taxi (20 min to Burj Dubai and Mall of The Emirates, 25 mins to Burj Khalifa/Dubai Mall, 30 mins to historic city centre). A shuttle bus can bring you to Mall of the Emirates and back. Rooms are clean, comfortable and well furnished, in Sheraton and other big chains (Marriott, Hilton etc..) style. Good continental breakfast with every kind of food.

Reviews.Title: “Indeed poor front desk service”
Reviews.Author: panda58
Reviews.Content: Hotel did not show up for airport pick up! Midnight... They did compensate company later on, but poor organization. Several front desk hick ups later on. Unprofessional. I agree with previous reviews onthis issue. Hotel in general is dated, not bad, but defintely under par compared to competition. Rooms very average, everything more or less ok, but very common. Extremely poor paid wireless internet in rooms. Inadmissible...one of the poorest I ever experienced. Fitness quite ok, modern technogym equipment. Overall verdict: certainly not first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good as always”
Reviews.Author: scotscalder
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to this Hotel and hope to be back again, We love this Hotel, food is very good, Staff are great remembering us and our names from previos visits. Lot of good improvements to Hotel since visit last year. Alexander Green From Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, incredibly bad traffic around the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: criswelldavis
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here in the past year. It is a 100 AED cab ride from the airport, but when you get about .5 km from the hotel you get mired in a virtual gridlock of cars and taxis. Granted, some of the cars are amazing, like Bentleys and Ferraris, but the traffic is unbelievable. I stayed here for a week and every time I headed to the hotel it was the same story. When I went to the airport at 7:00 p..m. on a Thursday night it took me about 25 minutes to travel less than .25 km from the front door of the hotel. The hotel has no control over this, but just be aware. The hotel staff are wonderful, the rooms are beautiful and the breakfast is excellent. I would stay here again, but be prepared for the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: abounajmfamily
Reviews.Content: very clean , very nice staff , delicious breakfast , great beach , and special thanks for mr osama ibrahim who did a great favour , and not to forget the club lounge it was so nice and calm , great location beside jbr

Reviews.Title: “great beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: tesco
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 17 dec, even though my reservation had been acidentaly cancelled by my tour operator travel2, for some crazy reason this was sorted out within hours not so good, after long flight, but hey ho wouldnt book with them again, hotel was fine food great, we arrived and it was happy hour in the bar so that was great. We got a taxi to Karma souk, great experience, then he took us to Atlantis, Amazing. we were able to have some sort of breakfast at 6am just before our next flight to oz

Reviews.Title: “Great for Free”
Reviews.Author: Musqat
Reviews.Content: I fondly remember the old days (1997) when I first moved to Dubai and the hotel was brand, spanking new and loomed large on the horizon as one of the only structures for miles around. Well, sadly, for me at least, those days are long gone. I stayed here in November as I had a free night as part of an SPG promotion. I'm a Starwood Platinum member and am usually very well treated at Dubai properties with perks and upgrades. From the get-go, there wasn't much recognition at check in and I didn't find the front desk crew very cordial. After a bit of wrangling, I managed to get a slight upgrade to a beach-facing room: lovely view, but the decor seemed rather dated. The lounge was well appointed and had a nice selection of offerings for breakfast, afternoon tea and happy hour. The best part of staying here, for me, was the ability to stroll down the beach to the Palm and also the proximity to the Walk, Marina and Metro, which are about a 10-minute walk from the hotel. All in all, I enjoyed my short stay, and would stay again if the rate were right (but not for the often exorbitant rate of DH 2000 per night).

Reviews.Title: “Older property on the Jumeirah beach.”
Reviews.Author: LoyaltyLobby
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a fine resort but doesn’t quite live up to the official five star rating. It is a solid four star hotel, however. Apparently, they do quite a bit of business through tour companies. There were lots of Russians and quite a few Swedes and Finns. At least TUI has this property sold through various “package” travel agencies in Europe. The hotel is located on the far end of the Jumeirah Beach Walk. This rather long street is full of restaurants and has some shops as well. On the other side of the road from the Sheraton is a Starbucks, which doesn’t offer free wireless, and a Thai restaurant. Stayed at this property twice.Once in October and then again in December. Both times I received a Junior Suite based on the Starwood Preferred Guest Platinum status. These junior suites aren’t the most modern ones. They are not bad by any means, but comparing to other hotels in the area, refurbishment is needed at some not so distant future. There is one pool on the property but the hotel, unlike some others, has direct beach access, so the sea is always nearby. There are plenty of chairs around the pool. Didn’t go to the pool but used the pool bar couple of times. You can order adult beverages and some basic bar food as well. I wasn’t overly satisfied with the pool bar, however. This was partly due to the constant noise from the nearby construction site. The Palm Garden looked wonderful. It was truly a garden like setting. One of the better fitness centers. When you sign in remember to request any towels that you might need. The locker room area doesn’t have any. Supposedly there had been few taken as the fitness center is open for paid visits as well. They have headphones available if you want to watch TV while working on the cardio machines. Remember that in the United Arab Emirates you are supposed to wear a towel all the time when in the locker room and in the sauna.This is due to the local customs. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again if the price is right. If you are looking for the most modern hotel and a great pool area, this hotel isn’t probably for you. It is great if you like hanging around in the palm garden and by the real beach. The area around the hotel is very pedestrian friendly, unlike some other surroundings in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: mariitta
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a two weeks holiday from Sheraton Jumeirah Dubai. We were family with 2 children and 4 adults. We had booked rooms for moths ahead. One room for 2 and one for 4. Still did not get a family room. They called us liars, we had not according to them booked a room for the children though we had all papers. Had to stay in a normal duble room with two kids. We had discussions with many other quest from Britain, Switzerland and Holland who all shared our opinon. Three stars at the most. If you want a holiday with sunny pool and beach, do not choose this hotel as the construction (that goes on even during the nights) will take away all sun. Higly overprised. We have stayd in three other hotels in Dubai before and always been satisfied. Not this time.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: BMK777
Reviews.Content: Just return from a 5 night NY break with 3 teenage children. We booked 2 twin rooms connecting but they coud not provide this. We had to accept twin on the same floor. Overnight flight and had to wait until after 3 pm to get our rooms. Huge 50 floor plus building under construction next to the hotel. Building noise is not too bad but with the other high rise buildings that totally overlook the hotel from the marina side sunbathing at the pool and gardens is very restrictive. Even on the beach you can lose the sun for several hours or you have to move several times a day. The gardens are beautiful and the beach Area nice. Friendly staff, small hotel with a warm feel. lovely buffet breakfast, food in general was excellent. The NY gala evening held in the gardens was superb and my teenage girls danced the night away. Well done to the hotel, 500 guests, great entertainment and superb food. lots of great places to eat, see the locals, people and car watch. very friendly, safe and not expensive. The location is OK a little out of the central area but we found the taxis reasonably priced. We would come back and stay in the hotel again. A great destination for teenage children, shopping, a large number of activities. We enjoyed the skiing, desert safari, Atlantis water park, golf, we only had time for one day on the beach. Weather superb in Dec/Jan and only 7 hours flying time from London. Overall a great value destination staying at a small friendly hotel with some great facilities. One suggestion, teenage children love iPhones, iPads so free wifi is vital. This hotel does offer it free of charge but you have to pick up 45 minute vouchers from the coffee shop. The hotel should consider making this free throughout the hotel on a simple one off login as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: macguire
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, there is construction going on right next door to the hotel( in it's final stages) so if one wants to hang out on the beach, bring your earplugs. This should only be temporary, of course. Check in was fast and friendly, and i booked this hotel on a points stay. Upgraded to the Executive suite, which was very nice. Was on the Club level floor and the staff were just wonderful. The lounge is fine, and they have a big choice of foods for breakfast, they also have fruit and small snacks there throughout the day. I found the pool to be too cold to use, which was unfortunate, but I'm sure that doesn't happen often,considering how hot it can get there. They have a nice gym facility, overlooking the grounds. All in all, the hotel is a bit old, compared to other hotels in the same category there, it needs refreshing. It's nice to be able to walk from the hotel, down to the shops and restaurants towards the Marina Walk.. The hotel car to me is a better option than a taxi( which don't always smell good), priced just slightly higher, for a much more comfortable ride! The excellent staff at this hotel definitely gave the overall rating a big help.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for relaxing and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Imran J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and I must say it was perhaps one of the most welcoming stays we've had. On arrival staff upgraded us to "Guest of the day" status and gave us a club room. We had mentioned it was my daughter's birthday (2 yrs) so they had a cake and glass of milk waiting in the room for us along with a stuffed toy and all bathroom amenities for kids :). During our stay our other daughter got sick and staff helped out in the middle of the night to arrange medication. The rooms were a good size as well and had a great view. The hotel is on "The Walk" - a sort of boulevard for visitors. Location wise it's a bit far from Diera and only mall nearby is Dubai Marina (which is not the best one in town). Overall - a highly recommended place for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “New Experience”
Reviews.Author: bubul34
Reviews.Content: The rooms are lest than 5 star quality/price, Careful with the lift, the doors are closing so fast that, the rest of your family will not follow you out of the elevator, the hotel taxi company do not take them they have different prices for the same way, the staff very friendly especially (Spa, the beach restaurant chief, staff in the entrance) There is a big construction beside "Sheraton" which is keeping the sun behind when you wish take your sunbath, so a several time you must change the place between the pool and the beach. The drinks in the hotel area more then expensive (for a glass of beer 40 AED= 10Euros) the food is ok but outside you can get much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ANAAYESHA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located at Jumeirah area,staff is very nice and breakfast has lot of varieties.Very close to this hotel is "The Walk" a kind of boulevard with nice restaurants, cafes and shops and also you will find local vendors with beautiful merchandise.It is little far from downtown (Deira) but always taxis available to Deira and to all the best malls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in the Sheraton Jumeira Beach”
Reviews.Author: IPSET
Reviews.Content: From a weather pespective, December is a perfect month to visit Dubai. Things even get better when staying at the Sheraton! Nice rooms, super clean environment, fantastic breakfasts, free wifi in the lobby area, beautiful garden with a relatively small private beach (pity that the next building takes away quite some sunshine throughout the day..). It was an exceptional great experience to meet staff with a can-do mentality - offering an overall Service with capital 'S' and a big smile. Thanks to Avril and her team, all the small hurdles that we faced during our visit to Dubai were smoothly eliminated. When we ever would plan a next trip to Dubai, the Sheraton will be the first hotel to be considered for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Overated as a 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: selfloadingfreight8
Reviews.Content: The property lies to the western end of the so called 'Jumeriah Beach' bordering the Jebal Ali industrial area which lies the other side of the inlet to the Marina. That side of the hotel is obscured by an enormous residential/hotel development that towers over the Sheraton. The Southern (land side) is notable for the Jumeriah Beach Residence Towers that block any view to the marina... it is a sheer wall of yellow brown stone & glass! At least the gardens have a pleasant view over the beach and the sea, with the Palm Jumeriah in the the distance. The beach road approaching the hotel can be a 'car park' on weekends and holidays just as the sun setting so allow plenty of time to arrive if you intend to there an hour before sunset. After sunset the JBR area seems to erupt into party mode with load music and cars blaring out stereos from open windows....not very relaxing at all! The hotel made an early appearance on the shore as such it shows its age compared to the more glamorous properties down the beach. As an SPG member I was hoping for a nice break with my wife in the hotel using up a voucher, and I upgraded our room on a cheap offer to a sea-facing room. However on check in the supervisor offered us an 'upgrade' by providing me with a sea facing room. When i pointed out to him that I had paid for the same, he said that the reservation did not reflect this. Although I was able to show him that I had a confirmation sent to me on a smart phone reflecting this, he insisted that I get a print out of the same to show his manager! When asked if I did this what would be the result be he said he could not tell me until the Manager had reviewed it. Although he promised faithfully to get the manager back to me in a reasonable time to tell what the hotel what do on this I never heard from his supervisor which is very disappointing. All credit to the check in member who said he would allow me to use the Towers lounge for refreshments and snacks in the evening in the meantime. However we felt that experience of a quiet night away was spoiled by the Hotels intransigence in not responding to their problems in the reservations system. The management need to to allow check-in staff more responsibility to respond to its guests concerns,especially if they belong to the SPG programme. The rooms are a good size (no balconies) if a bit spartan in decor. The TV channel selection whilst reasonable is not extensive. The Towers lounge again whilst pleasant and comfortable for a drink does not cater very well when busy during happy hours when service is slow and the food selection is soon depleted. I feel that the Sheraton needs to consider its future with this property as it is fast becoming a an eye-sore on the sea-front in an already overcrowded, concrete & glass hell!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and enjoy the sunshine!”
Reviews.Author: jayandme
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel right on the beach with excellent service. Rooms are good...not great but service makes it a great place to stay! Lots of foreigners and can be crowded. The breakfast is good! Pool has swim up bar. Good restraunts and services within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location at the sea”
Reviews.Author: tygrlive
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 beautiful days at Sheraton Jumeira. It was my 8th visit of Dubai and second hotel at Marina. I really like the location of Sheraton - you live directly at the privat beach, they have pool bar and we were enjoying Jumeirah Beach walk with plenty of shops & cafes. On other hand the hotel is little bit older, may be some refreshments are planned (just now they are rebuilding Beach lounge)... The staff was friendly and they were solving all situations fast. Just at our arrival our booked rooms were not ready and was nessesary move another day (planned was at 4pm but it was moved to late evening. Not nice :() There are some restaurants and bars at the hotel, we visited all of them but liked more drink&eat outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WendySwiss
Reviews.Content: What can I say but a super time was had at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Hotel. Great location and great Place to stay to enjoy the beautiful warm sea, shaded gardens with palms but also possible to have sun and in addition nice pool area.All staff very friendly and helpful. Need to remember to put the service light on if you want the room serviced. Rooms are a little dated but not a problem as the location makes up for it. Worth to pay a little extra and book a Sea view. Yes there is a new tower block going up next door but this is happening everywhere in Dubai so not the hotels fault and you soon don't notice. Free internet in the 24hr lobby cafe. 4 computers available and can pick up free 45mins codes for the computers and also for wireless. There is a shuttle to the Mall Of Emirates from the hotel so ask the consierge for the timetable. Also possible to take shuttles to other hotels from the Mall. Lots of cheap Eats along The Walk which is a good option for lunch. We had a cake left in the room for our Anniversary so a nice touch and ice Machine on the floor - also much appreciated. Metro about 15/20 mins walk and suggest to buy the silver top up card if planning to use a few times. Fabulous, great toilets, Spotless, busy, safe and trains running between every 3 to 10mins. The Dubai Marina area is great and suggest to book on the 1.5hr Yellow Boat, Palm Jumeirah, Burg Al Arab and Marina Tour http://theyellowboats.com/ - great fun and some great photos. We booked a great tour , Safari to the Hajar Mountains in Oman http://www.arabian-adventures.com/. Arrived on time in 4W drive with great picnic lunch. Check out the website. Great tour company even if a little more expensive. Thats it - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECHUK
Reviews.Content: Good view of the Burj. Nice pool areas with access into Wild Wadi which is a bonus. Very busy and quite expensive. If you dont have children I would opt for the Ritz Carlton instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the far end of Jumeira Beach, next door a big noisy costruction site, very good breakfast buffet, nice staff. 10 min walk to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mousiekeeper
Reviews.Content: OK, next to a conatruction site but don't let that spoil anything - location is good. Hotel is great, facilities excellent, food spot on and staff so helpful and friendly. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Jane D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic and the staff were so polite, respectful and couldn't do enough for us, the food was fab especially the Chinese restaurant where the waiter Israel was the nicest friendliest person you could wish to meet. It was spotless and we both feel so rested and pampered, thankyou to the Sheraton for giving us a wonderful holiday from Jane and Nicole

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pcsnoopy
Reviews.Content: I was told by my boyfriend who booked our hotel that this was one of the older hotels in Dubai but the location is prime due to the beach. He was right, the hotel has its own area of the beach set up with lounge chairs and umbrellas, towels and drink and snack service. You literally walk out of the hotel and step onto the beach. This is really what makes this hotel. Our room was kept fairly clean and the metro station and many restaurants were located within walking distance. We tried the Italian restaurant in the hotel which was really good. Plenty of taxis around in case you don't want to walk in the heat. I did have a few issues though. I felt for a 5 star hotel the bathroom was a bit dated in decor. We also had a private patio, but all there wasn't much out on the patio as far as ambiance except two lounge chairs and a tiny table with two chairs. We ate lunch out there once and had to cram our food on the tiny table. There was also a building being constructed right next door, and some of the noise could be heard in morning and throughout the day. I was also surprised that there was no free wi-fi at this hotel or anywhere nearby. Some of the other hotels located on the beach had free wi-fi for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: macrodonts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a 3 day stop off prior to the Maldives. We have stayed in Dubai marina before but really wanted to stay at the beach. We checked in very early morning and our room was not available but the receptionist ensured it was dealt with asap. The room was on the 6th floor it had fantastic views of the beach, though the room was a little old fashioned it was clean and spacious. The bedding and towels were of good quality too. We did not eat at the hotel as there are so many amazing places to eat on your doorstep and it is great to get out and people watch too. The beach was clean and not overcrowded, the pool area was nice and they even had a resident cat who took a shine to me. This hotel may not be the most modern in the area but the staff are very nice and helpful, the location is amazing. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “averagre”
Reviews.Author: dubai92
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,like only becaude of his location. I stayed here for 2 nights in december was their in dubai for official.company visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ...”
Reviews.Author: EuroTrav2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel for sure meets the expectations from a 5 star Sheraton hotel, I stayed for a weekend with my wife during mid June and we really liked the hotel but we were really surprised to know that the swimming pool and the beach close at 9PM and it was not allowed to swim or stay at the beach after 9!!, I personally think they should be open until mid night especially in hot summer. The hotel is located in Marina which is one of the best resort places in Dubai but one should keep in mind that driving through the Marina walk takes time to reach to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent View”
Reviews.Author: Tarazikhaled
Reviews.Content: Although the Hotel is Old vs. all other Hotels in the area yet still unique in the service and Quality of food.

Reviews.Title: “A little Old - but with Some Charm”
Reviews.Author: Brit-abroad-in-Asia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the older hotels in Dubai, but it has a certain charm and was genuinely quite pleasant. Despite being a bit old, it has everything you need - nice beachfront, good size pool, pool bar (with free ice-lollies in the heat), lots of sunbeds, a table-tennis table - etc. The rooms are of a reasonable size and because the hotel isn't too big its not very crowded. The executive lounge evening drinks were fun and food choices were good for all meals. And, its quite well located in the marina area so easy to get out an walk around. When I first walked in I wasn't expecting to enjoy this as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “nice place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: alyeldomery
Reviews.Content: the double room was very good, clean and spacious, the pool is very small and crouded, the hotel has a private beach.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Beckyjack22
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from the Sheraton and lived it it was very clean and well looked after and the staff couldnt have been more helpful. I was travelling alone with a 4yr old and found this hotel to be very welcoming and friendly. The breakfast buffet was wonderful it had everything I needed and when my son was Ill I was helped with getting medical care. It was Ramadan during my visit and within the Walls of the hotel I wouldnt have noticed and it didn't effect my stay. This hotel isn't as large and as high rise as the rest of Dubai and I found that this added to it's charm and I would not hesitate to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel nice location.”
Reviews.Author: L1N4
Reviews.Content: Having a family holiday in July 2011, we stayed at this hotel, the reception staff were very welcoming and the breakfast staff were fantastic, having a small baby and child with me, they full field their request, in particular Brain he was friendly and my boy was happy to always talk to him as Brian would always make some time to listen to him. I would have to say that the only thing that bothered me was that when we checked out we was told that 1 item was missing out of the mini bar, but was sorted out in the end. Id always checks that now!!!! The hotel could do more in regards to children’s facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Will definatley return”
Reviews.Author: brilinLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights 16th July to 26th July we had a wonderful room with bacony with sea view but also overlooking The Walk. The pool and gardens were exceptionally well kept and Arshad was an extremely friendly pool attendant. Alan and his team in the pool bar again gave an excellent, friendly service and supplied all guests at the pool and beach with iced face cloths and ice lollies. The food in The Palm restaurant was outstanding and we were certainly spoilt for choice. The pleasant young girl always made sure my husbands omelette was ready for him at breakfastfast, she must have watched to see us come into the restaurant ! The waiting staff were always very friendly, polite and delivered an excellent service. Dipanka always went the extra mile, along with a beaming smile, a big thankyou to him, hope the bar training is going well! Ajay another excellent member of staff. Last but not least Brian Desouza, what can I say an absolutley first class Restaurant Manager. Brian is polite, humerous and finds time for everyone. He certainly know his role and leads his team by example. Thankyou for a great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: RoulaAssi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on JBR Road which is the most crowded by tourists and restaurants beside the neat hotel's private beach. The rooms are very neat and tidy The staff are very efficient The food is very good.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best !”
Reviews.Author: albert89
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a 'half board ' basis for 14 lovely nights from 13th -27th july. The hotel facilities and surroundings were fabulous, as was our land view rooms, extremely clean with everything we needed. The standard and variety of food at breakfast and evening meals was outstanding, anything you would ever wish for was provided. The staff : from chief chef Engleburt, Kumar and Giotani, to the waitering staff, particularly Brian (manager), Roomark,, Rajah, Mohamed, Mustafa were truely amazing, we were treated like VIP's, all of them were friendly, polite and very attentive and genuinely wanted to make sure we were happy and had everything we needed. Our time spent in the Palm Garden resturant was most memorable and extremely satisfying. The gardens and pool area were immaculate, the beach was lovely but the sea water was hot with no relief. The pool was much more refreshing and again the service was just supurb, complimentry ice loolies cool face clothes, and great fun and interaction with Salem and his boss lol Sameh. My son and I were invited to play some soccer with staff and we were so impressed to see Mr Dagher ( GM), and other senior members of staff interact with such sincerity and genuine participation, we were made to feel part of the Sheraton family. The 'Link' cafe open 24 hours provided free internet , something we have not had in all our previous hotels, the gym was comprehensive and not busy and the 2 off squash courts were a welcomed break from the intense heat! This is our 5th trip to dubai, we have stayed at the Shangri la, Habtoor, Marriott suites etc but to us the Sheraton is "simply the best" We would most deffinately recommend this hotel 100%. Although an older hotel for Dubai standards we felt that this added to the atmosphere, charm and genuine friendliness of this superb place to stay, we can't wait to go back. Thank you to all our new friends in the Sheraton who made our stay the most enjoyable, pleasurable and memorable time ever.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Char234
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Nice loaction on Jumeriah Beach. The pool was good size with bar. Lots of Europeans staying here. Beach was lovely, could see Atlantis. Did not eat at the hotel. although bought drinks at the pool bar for £4 for a can of coke!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied and fantastic coffee!”
Reviews.Author: Robbo281081
Reviews.Content: The service and friendliness of the staff is good. Came here last september. The hotel could have had better beach Facilities considering its great location, also the breakfast buffet was disappointing compared to other hotels. Loved the coffee and coffee shop though, its the same coffee i have when i visit Hamburg! Robbo

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: mck0905
Reviews.Content: Although I have used SPG program to stay here this time, the hotel nonethelss upgraded to me a great ocean-view room with balcany. Everyone at the hotel is so friendly and helpful (e.g. reception, pool, beach, sap)...Although this hotel may be a bit outdated when compared to Westin and Le Meridien that are also on the beach, I would come back due to the superb service!

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly beach hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: face4
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here after the week of Christmas on points and we were given a nice sized suite (the decor is a little dated throughout the hotel) and were able to enjoy the beach, swimming pool and spacious grounds. The children loved the buffet and the Chinese restaurant was also very good. We found the Sheraton club lounge to be one of the best that we've visited in the world. It was nice to see that the hotel also has a racquet ball court even though we didn't have the time to use it. Great service and great location on the beach!!! Our family would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Old but good”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed_Alnazar
Reviews.Content: Old decorated hotel, but good facilities. Nice private beach and welcoming staff. Was late on check in process.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a suite facing the sea. It was a great, relaxed stay. The reception staff made us feel extremely welcome on arrival and could not have been any friendlier. The suite was comfortable and well sound proofed. The bathrooms are dated and need redoing. Food was good, pool area, beach and pool were really very good. The sea was so hot, I have never experienced anything like it, it was 36c, like a hot bath, try it

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a little old for a 5 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: jedi27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October 2010. We stayed in the first room only for one night, as the staff told us they couldn't give us a room for the two weeks immediately. This was actually a good thing, the first room being next to a construction site, ergo very loud and unpleasant to see. When we changed rooms, I insisted on having a room further away from the construction site, which we got. This establishment is on of the first along Jumeirah Walk and is getting a bit old, especially when compared with the other hotels in the neighbourhood. Proximity to Jumeirah Walk is a huge plus, as you can find almost everything on this walk, restaurants, shops, pharmacy, you name it. Service is excellent, definitely worthy of a 5 stars hotel. Hotel has a taxi service, which is more expensive than the regualr Dubai taxi service, but still cheap enough. Good restaurants, interesting food. Pool, garden and beach are great. All things considered, not worth the price, but a good experience altogether. Next time in Dubai, we will book a hotel not located along the sea - there are some very nice 5 stars hotels inland - saving a lot of money but still being in a luxury hotel. Lot of Russian tourists, some a little rude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not up to its full potential”
Reviews.Author: blueroose
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at the end of May. The room was nice, the facilities also well-maintained. The pool was nice, though I was not able to use it. The concierge staff were also top notch. The hotel is also located in an ideal location, at the beginning of the JBR walk. Very nice if you wish to walk. However, it was the little things that make a 4 or 5 star and that lacked at this hotel. The service at the cafe was awful. AWFUL. I got in at 4 am and was told to wait at the cafe until a room came available, where I ordered breakfast with NO meat, and asked for extra potatoes instead. I repeated it twice to make sure. She brought it with meat - when I reminded her I didn't want meat, she gave me a small plate and told me to move it! I asked her to, so she literally slid the bacon and sausage off the plate, leaving just the eggs....those were expensive eggs! Also, the iron....oh my, what a huge ordeal for a simple iron and ironing board! The first one was broken, maybe one from the 1980s. It spilled water all over my pants and the bottom was so scratched that it ruined my pants. And the ironing board was badly stained and again, like 20 years old. I called the next day and made a kind notice to the manager, informing him that its these small things that can ruin the image of a fine hotel. He agreed and sent up another OLD scratched iron. Pathetic. They left fruit and a bottle of wine (I don't drink) the next day to make up for my ruined pants. Additionally, there was a lot of shadiness. There were obvious escorts coming in and out with men at all times of the day and night. I felt like I would be mistaken for one when I'd come down to the lobby to use the internet at 2 am. Which gets me to my final disappointment...what 4 or 5 star hotel doesn't have internet in the rooms? 100 AEDs per day is pretty steep for internet usage. Half the time, the computers in the cafe didn't work either. Oh, one last note -- the guys outside who call you a cab - they need to stop pushing private limousines on guests, lying to them that it costs the same as a regular taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Worst Dive center ever”
Reviews.Author: pfcdavetina
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, went to stay with friends on vacation. Cannot beat it for style or location. The building works are a little frustrating but for Dubai to get better yo must build. BIG criticism is dive center. Instructor was rude and when I listened he was slurring his words. Decided I was better off not diving then I saw him chatting to a man from the office and followed them to watch them keep drinking. At 2pm in teh afternoon!!! And then the guy took someone out for a dive. UNBELIEVABLE. One owner, one instructor on the beer in front of customers. NOT a good thing for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Staff and Location *****”
Reviews.Author: gcnewforest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 7 night visit at the end of May and cannot praise the hotel, staff and location highly enough. Two criticisms to get out of the way quickly - yes there is buidling work going on next door but you don't hear or see it most of the time. In fact I was only aware of it because I looked following the reviews on here ! Don't worry, it is not at all intrusive. Second - try to avoid the buffet dinner on Thursday night when the belly dancer is in. She's great but the music is just so loud and intrusive you'll want to go outside to listen to the sound of the construction work !! I have no idea why they have this in the middle of the restaurant - it's a real shame as so few people are listening or getting involved. Now the positives - and there are many ! Great staff - particular mention to the Maitre d' in the restaurant, Brian. He is just so helpful, friendly, attentive, professional - a real gem. He was fantastic and seemed to be there 24x7. I hope the hotel recognise him in some way as he is so good. The other is Hari at the pool bar - cool dude or what ? Very chatty and always around when it got too hot. He just seemed to know when we were in need of water, a beer or a cold towel. Great guy and good fun - his name is Hari but everyone, including his bosses know him as Harry - cool shades Hari !! The rooms are very comfortable, clean and tidy. We were treated like royalty for the week and really enjoyed it. The location with a choice of either poolside, garden or private beach is fantastic although I would like to ask the hotel to have some ice shipped in to the sea please - it's very warm !! There is a great selection of shops and restaurants along the seafront or promenade - everything from the ubiquitous Starbucks to some very upmarket dineries. We tried Frankies ( Frankie Detorri and Marco Pierre White's joint venture ) which was fabulous although somewhat interesting as a blazing row between the Maitre d' and Sommelier erupted in the middle of service - very unprofessional but very entertaining ! I would highly recommend this hotel - it's not big and glitzy like some of the other so called 7 star establishments. If you want 1500+ bedrooms and impersonal service don't stay here. If you want genuine, friendly, welcoming, warm professionalism - this is your hotel. We'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and check out the Ciao Ristorante”
Reviews.Author: swiss_r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton for three days on our way through to the Maldives. I can honestly say that this hotel is the best I have ever stayed in. We were made to feel so welcome and with it being our honeymoon, had a fruit basket, wine and a big chocolate cake in our room on arrival! The pool is reasonably sized and has a pool bar and there are a range of options for sunbathing spots, including a nice garden and private beach. If you have a sea view room, the Jumeira palm looks amazing at night with the Atlantis all lit up. The metro station is around a 15 minute walk and taxis are pretty cheap. The concierge will arrange these for you and also give you great tips on what to see and do. There is also a free shuttle to the 'Mall of the Emirates' where you can shop, catch the metro or visit Ski Dubai. You MUST dine at the Ciao Ristorante. The Italian food there is some of the best I have ever tasted and I have eaten at a lot of native restaurants around Milan!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: JoanneHudson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a surprise 50th birthday. The hotel facilities and surroundings were fabulous, as was our land view room. Extremely clean with everything we needed.The only thing I would recommend is to bring your own hair dryer as the wall mounted one was not good. The breakfast was outstanding, anything you would ever wish for breakfast was provided. The staff were amazing, all of them were friendly, polite and very attentive and genuinely wanted to make sure we were happy and had everything we needed. We were presented with a complimentary birthday cake by 10 singing breakfast staff on the morning of my friends 50th birthday which made her feel very special, and the cake was scrummy! The gardens and pool area were immaculate, the swim up bar a delightful bonus, the beach was lovely but I was shocked at how hot the sea water was! The pool was much more refreshing. Alcohol is expensive in Dubai, but if you make the most of 'happy hour' in Moods bar from 7pm - 9pm it becomes less so. I would recommend this hotel 100%. It is an 'old' hotel for Dubai standards but this added to the atmosphere, charm and friendliness of this superb place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelWorld78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 24th - 28th May, where we booked a standard room. On arrival at 08.30 we were told that we would have to wait for the room till 11.30 (usual check in time is 3pm!) We were upgraded automatically to a Tower Suite on the 8th floor. When we got the room at 12pm, we left our luggage in the store area and we were told we could use all the recreational facilities until the room was ready. The lobby is large with plenty of seating available.  It was my wife's 30th Birthday and out wedding anniversary. Housekeeping bought us two luxury chocolate mousse cakes with a fresh fruit basket to our room! We were spoilt! What a fantastic surprise and very thoughtful of them!  The room was huge, with separate dining area, lounge, super kingsize bed , very spacious bathroom equipped with designer toiletries, 40in plus tv with DVD player, mini bar, safe and complimentary water! amongst other amenities. Our room was cleaned daily and offered views of the JBR. Do go to the 8th floor tower lounge which has breathtaking views of the Arabian sea and good views of the pool areas. The hotel is in a great location within the JBR area with an array of up market restaurants, cafes, and shops. There is an Almaya supermarket across the JBR which is convenient to stock up on groceries as prices in the hotel are inflated. The beach is clean, with superb views looking onto the palm island. There are plenty of sun loungers for everyone to use with bar staff waiting to take drinks orders. Sea was very warm and not over crowded. Hotel offers variety of water sports. It is beginning to get extremely hot now approaching summer season. Remember to apply lots of sun screen!   The hotel is a 5min drive from the Jumeirah Lake Towers metro station by taxi which costs 10 dhirams. It's only about 15-20mins walk away but it was very hot approx 36deg in the sweltering dry heat, therefore transport is best. The metro costs 11dhirams to get into downtown Dubai and takes approximately 30mins. Breakfast at the hotel was faultless everything you can imagine with exceptionally friendly staff. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you. There are 3 restaurants in the hotel and an outside alfresco  eatery with pub style food with patio furniture, music and large projector screen. There is also an Arabian sheesha bar which was always packed with people during the evenings. The gym is a good size, there is a squash court, sauna and steam room. The swimming pools with swim up bar were very clean but very busy during the day time. Difficult to get a sun lounger poolside. The hotel grounds are pristine clean, sea facing with vast amounts of sun lounges on the lawn area, offering plenty of shade amongst the palm trees. Downside there is no Jacuzzi and the steam and sauna were not turned on. You had to inform the staff at the health club reception that you wanted to use it so they could switch it on. Very inconvenient.  It was very disappointing that 5star hotels do not offer shuttles to the airport. A taxi will cost around 70dhirams and take 25mins off peak times. Expect 40mins during peak times. The concierges will try to book you a private taxi to airport. Do not use them as they are twice the price. Beware there is a large construction project beside the hotel working away 24/7. Not a good site to see. Noisy at times but this then becomes background noise.  The hotel has a gift shop, jewellery shop, sports shop besides having a beauty salon offering variety of massages and treatments that are over priced. Do not get a taxi through the concierge as the prices are hiked up. Get a cab from the JBR beside the hotel entrance where they are priced by meter. Overall we had a fantastic time here with the staff particularly going the extra mile to please! The hotel lives up to 5 stars and we would definately visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the stay very much However ...”
Reviews.Author: JUNEJEFF
Reviews.Content: We had a good time here ,weather was great ...Staff were so kind a very helpful apart from one guy on reception ,I cant remember his name .We were half board in .this hotel has four restraunts inside hotel so we thought this would apply to them aswell ..First we had food when we got the bill ! we said we half board in the hotel ,the waiter replied we would get 100 dhs towards the meal only ..but we didnt mind we never had half board before so didnt know the format.The second night which was Chinese food ..again we had to mention we were half board ...oh the waiter said that doesnt apply here at all you have to pay the full bill ..so we did ! We went to the hotel reception and we said we were a bit confused what was happening here! The guy on reception said we only get half board in the Buffet food Dining hall ...which we dont like !! So next time we didnt bother and ate outside of hotel for the rest of the holiday !! We wouldnt go back to this hotel for sure because of this .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ali1406
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on 16th May 2011 and can honestly say, we have no faults at all about this hotel! The situation on the beach is beautiful overlooking the Palm. The rooms were very very clean and well presented, we actually got upgraded to a sea view on arrival which was very much appreciated! Our view was outstanding! After reading reviews on here, yes there are building works going on next to the hotel but it did not have any negative effect on our break and we didnt notice it at all. Plus your in Dubai, there are building works everywhere! Breakfast was delicious every morning and the staff in the Moods bar were always very helpful and chatty, and they make delicious mojitos, the best i'd ever tasted in fact! The pool was lovely and very welcoming in the 45 degree heat! Would not hesitate at all to stay at this hotel on a return visit to dubai.

Reviews.Title: “An Old hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SayanRoy
Reviews.Content: By the time you reach the hotel, you have passed all the good looking and new hotels of Dubai. Sheraton Jumeriah is among the oldest and is at the end of the beach with its own private beach so good location but the architecture looks faded. I had prebooked by room by a day as I was arriving in the morning, inspite of the same the room was not ready and I had to wait for 1 hr. Later they did upgrade me to sea view but with twin beds instead of a double bed. On complaint they offered free dinner(which I did not take as the pricncipal is service) as compensation but did not give or offer a double bed room. The breakfast room was full and during peak season, i would think that people would have to wait. The service at the breakfast was amazing, the people are all smiling, wishing you a good morning and the spread is good. The beach is a private, hotel resident only and that is a major advantage. Also, since it is at the end of the city if you plan to go to Abu Dhabi it saves some time. In conclusion, an old hotel in a good holiday location

Reviews.Title: “great holiday but not 5 star...”
Reviews.Author: dieseldollly
Reviews.Content: After checking reviews on the hotel I was feeling a bit dubious about staying here...however we had a great time. Upon arrival at the hotel at 8 am we were told our room wasnt available which wasnt a problem as we had breakfast and went a sunbathed by the pool. We had booked on a bed and breakfast basis but were pleasantly surprised to be told we had been upgraded to half board! The guy on reception (think his name was Radii) was really kind and helpful and had our room ready for us by midday. Our room was lovely and very clean. It looked out onto the walk. Although there is building work going on next door, it didnt affect us or our holiday. After visiting Dubai 6 times its something you get used too. The food was good with a good selection at each meal..however it wasnt of a 5 star standard really. The restaurant staff were fantastic and so helpful, especially Brian, Romain and Mohammed. I dont know how they keep there cool and are so polite as some of the guests were incredibly rude to them and treated them terribly. Shame on them.... We really enjoyed our stay and would like to thank everyone at the hotel for making our holiday so much fun...

Reviews.Title: “I hope you smoke!”
Reviews.Author: AndyPokolbin
Reviews.Content: We arrived off a 13 hour flight from JFK and upon arrival we were very tired and wanting some rest. We were told that the hotel was full and that had been 'upgraded' to a superior room but will need to move rooms the next day. Well this was not what we wanted to hear and as we had been travelling for 10 days in NYC we had lots of luggage. The thought of spending our 3 days in Dubai unpackling and then re-packing and then the same again was not what we wanted. When we finally got to our room it STUNK of smoke and my wife and I are non smokers we nearly vomitted. The front desk did nothing to assist us. My wife was in tears at this point and we then decided to move hotels. We did this at 3am and very tired indeed and the although we had only spent 2 hours in the hotel they still charged us for a full nights stay. Very dissapointing however the hotel we moved to made up for evrything.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Dubai”
Reviews.Author: MartinDG61
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sheraton in mid-April after an extensive review of the alternatives. We even scouted the hotel before hand! The building work next to the hotel will go on for a little while yet an although a slight irritation it blends in after a while. The hotel is a good standard and only suffers from comparison to the slightly newer more over the top hotels such as Atlantis or Jumeriah Beach. The concierge staff were very helpful and polite. The buffet breakfast had a wide choice and although busy most days it was possible to find space. The hotel grounds are big enough to cope with the hotel size and all in all it is a relaxed and comfortable hotel. As you would expect drinks are expensive as is pool side food but you should know that anyway if you are staying in such a hotel so don't be suprised. The private beach is a bonus. The downside is that it is at the furthest end of The Walk from everything else so don't get a taxi to take you that route unless you have a large bank balance. The hotel is near to a number of resturants with a wide range of pricing, styles and food, so it's a matter of taste and budget. We also visited Atlantis & Wild Wadi water parks - the latter being slightly better if you only want to go to one. Take time to go on the desert safari - the morning is better (which we did) apparently as there are less vehicles around at the time - although you don't get the dinner and evening show. Visit the Burj Kalifa in the evening to see the musical fountains (like Bellagio in Vegas). For cheap shopping don't go to the main malls get a taxi to Karama and enjoy bargaining but don't always expect significant quality. Use the local taxis, rather than the hotel provided cars as they are much cheaper and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: LiudaSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 10 days. My husband is a member of the SPG. We were upgraded to a deluxe sea-view room. The room was really nice and the service was excellent as well. It was really sweet to come back to your room in the evenings and find your bed turned down and find a lovely chocolate by your pillow. We had breakfast on the 9th floor which was delicious and the staff were kind and friendly. Also there was a snack all through the day including the happy hours. The swimming pool had its own cocktail bar with tasty drinks. There was a lovely beach with plenty of sunbeds. In the hotel the sauna and steam room are a good temperature but the shower room needs to be cleaned more. I enjoyed my visit to the beauty salon in the hotel. I did my manicure and pedicure,the lady does an excellent job. The hotel is in a good location as there are many restaurants on the Jumeirah Walk and is close to the metro. We were advised by the staff that it is better to use the metro as it is cheaper and quicker than a taxi but taxis are still cheap. We had a brilliant time in the Sheraton but it would be even better if there were more kids activities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HanifUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed 14 nights over Easter. Location is excellent with the nearby Walk at JBR. This is for you if you want a beach holiday without the hassle of getting taxis to find places to eat. There is construction next door but the hotel and service overshadowed that. Has excellent gardens along with a good pool. Room cleaning was very good, we had a 1 year old baby crawling around so this was important to us. The hotel is about 40 minutes taxi ride from the airport and city area, this didnt bother us as we went specifically for the beach which was excellent, very safe for children. A special mention to Sanjeer on reception who displayed excellent customer service along with the Manager Mustafa.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay - but some may want to wait for the adjacent building works to be completed”
Reviews.Author: Parseltongue
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is a bit impersonal, it is a Sheraton and lives up to the standards you expect from a Sheraton. We stayed 8 nights in the hotel. It's not ultra modern and in a sense all the better for that - everything works (except the key cards which had to be reset half-a-dozen times for each room) We arrived at 1:00 am to find out that our allocated rooms were on separate floors. As the hotel was full that night we were promised that we would be changed to the same floor the next day - and this was done with no fuss at all. Full marks for delivering on the promise. Overall service was excellent thoughout our stay. We had half-board which was ideal as we could choose between lunch or dinner depending on what we were doing that day. All meals were served in the main restaurant, with an excellent buffet breakfast and a good variety of buffet meals at both lunchtime and evening. Food was not Michelin starred quality but very acceptable - particularly the starters/salad bar. The rooms were comfortable with full amenities including complimentary daily replenished bottles of water. We didn't have a balcony (can't complain as we hadn't paid for it) but the view over the ocean was spectacular. A negative is that the hotel does not have free wi-fi in the rooms, although it did have free wi-fi in the public areas with four computers available for use (sensibly limited to a maximum of 45 minutes a session). The pool was of a good size, but at very busy times we found that the pool and surrounding areas could be very crowded. The grounds are well laid out and in particular there is a lovely lawned area between the swimming pool and beach which has large palm trees providing shelter. This is ideal for reading a book or just relaxing. However, be aware that you may find the noise from the adjacent building site somewhat intrusive. It did disappear into the background noise after a few minutes, but some people may be disturbed. In this case, wait a couple of years before visiting when the building work is completed. The location at the end of JBR Walk is a bit of a pain if taking taxis back to the hotel as all of Dubai seems to be out driving at a snails pace in their prestige cars, which makes the last mile a real crawl. The hotel is also some 25 KMs from downtown Dubai, so if easy access to Dubai is important to you this may not be the right location. Access to the Emirates Mall and the Burj Khalifa is very good though. The only really discordant note is the hotel promoting their own (more expensive, even if metered) luxury limousines instead of regular taxis. We made this mistake once, and after that just walked a few extra yards to the Walk and found a regular taxi. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel. If we could we would have given the hotel 4 1/2 out of 5, missing out on the five rating because of the building works. If staying in Dubai again for a relaxing holiday we would be very happy to come back to the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: sunny-singh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in the last week of March and throughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived at 8.30am and though check in was not till the afternoon we were given a room without any issues. We were on half board and enjoyed the breakfast and the changing dinners each night. The gym is a good size for a hotel. The pool area and the beach were lovely and there were plenty of sun beds to go around. The hotel also provide free shuttles to Mall of Emirates and Dubai Mall. The location is great on Jumeirah Walk with a number of cafes & restaurants within walking distance. Staff were excellent and always willing to help. Would stay here again without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position and excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: lbl16
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered excellent service in every respect The room was a little dissappointing at first as we had asked for non smoking and it clearly smelled of smoke.Afdter we pointed out that their policy says all rooms are non smoking yet they provide 3 ashtrays, no less, in each room how did they ever expect smokers not to smoke .They swiflty changed us to another room.Neither of these rooms were sea facing but the additional charge was considerable and frankly the room was excellent and we only slept in it as we were out all day.It had every facility you could need lovely towels and toiletries,TV Bar etc comfotable chairs really was excellent.No noise whatsoever from the building work outside. We had spent 10 days in the Maldives prior to this and we had been warned about the building work ongoing.It was not until we arrived that we realised what this meant.Most of Dubai is a building site and next to this hotel is another being built and 24/7. So if you need peace and quiet in the gardens forget it but honestly there was no problem in your room and the contrast for us was greater coming form the peaceful Maldives. The hotel is in a fabulous location,it is on the beach with fantastic gardens and pool luxuriously furnished and serviced by staff. It is at the end of THE WALK which is a promenade of hotels shops and restaurants so that eating out is a dream and restaurants range from expensive to moderate chains such as PIzza Express.There is a local pharmacy and also supermarkjets .The new metro is around half a mile away so access to the whole of Dubai is great and it is certainly worth seeing (Both metro and Dubai).The hotel is a block or two from the new Marina area. Best sights - Burj Khalif the tallest building in the world Best activities - Ski Dubai ,trip down the Creek on boat and to the gold souk,Dune Safari, Shopping - unless you have more money than sense shopping here is expensive much cheaper at home but the malls MUST be seen they are something else. All in all a faultless stay. PS the Management did tell us that they are working towards all non smoking rooms . They were easily forgiven as in everything esle they shone . Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way,very comfortable and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JPM32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Dubai World cup and ill tell ya straight out this hotel is absolutely perfect for a week in Dubai.I arrived in reception and got an upgrade to a lovely room with a walk out balcony overlooking the walk and the beach.The swimming pool is brilliant and the swim up bar is amazing to have a cold pint and then fall back into the water..perfect..The beach is super with great watersports amenities and there are lifeguards on duty.There is loads of sunlounges on the beach and under the palms in the garden. The sevice is fantastic all over the hotel and Rajan who serviced our room every day did a tremendous job and looked after us very well.We had 2 massages in the spa and they were excellent by thai masseurs.The bar is great and the staff were excellent there and the bar man makes a very nice strawberrydaqueri cocktail(highly recommended). Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and well done to Danny the manager on providing a good all round service..trust me you will have a pleasant stay at this hotel and feel at ease..My only regret is that i didnt go to the beach more in the morning but thats what happens when you stay up late guzzling strawberrydacqueris.See ye all next year again for the 2012 world cup..thanks Sheraton Dubai for a fantastic holiday

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fergie_Heights50
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel, could not find anything to complain about, rooms and food great, lovely gardens and the staff so pleasant and helpful. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best trips”
Reviews.Author: milada_matiovska
Reviews.Content: A great location on the Jumeirah Beach, great services in a hotel, very nice stuff, beautiful hotel garden, perfect beach services.... I can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: nearly50Scotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton for a week at the beginning of March. We were slightly anxious having read some of the negative reviews - well we really needn't have been. Yes, in comparison to some of the other Dubai hotels we have stayed in it is slightly dated looking but everywhere was exceptionally clean and comfortable, and the bedrooms were well appointed. We stayed in a tower bedroom,yes there is building work in the near vicinity but this honestly didn't affect us in any way at all. Food was good, both at breakfast and at the buffet style themed evenings, also at the pool area for lunch. There are plenty of restaurants/fast food places along the walk if you don't want to eat in the hotel. The staff at the Sheraton were in the majority very pleasant and helpful, especially the main restaurant manager who seemed to work incredibly long hours. The beach and pool areas were clean and comfortable, plenty of beds and towels and shade if you wanted it. The hotel was busy with guests of all nationalities - I think the climate at this time of year is a major advantage ! So, to summarize, a really good all round non flashy decent hotel. Would we return ? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “The epitome of staff training that you feel/sense as soon as you enter the hotel”
Reviews.Author: rozpickles
Reviews.Content: If you are not a millionaire but want to stay at a special location, where you will be treated like one, the Jumeiria Beach Hotel will fit the bill. Several restaurant that cater for all tastes, al fresco or fine dining. Relaxing location with wonderful car /limo service that can take you to do all your sight seeing There is such a sense that all the employees just want you to have a great stay at their hotel. We especially love the staff from Sri Lanker with their wonderful smiles and character.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: simonmcnamara968
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family during half term. The hotel is older than most in Dubai, but it has lovely pool, grounds and beach. I am an SPG Platinum guest and the service was excellent, check in smooth and room upgrade to a junior suite. Staff were very friendly, breakfast in was a bit busy in the main restaurant, but the breakfast in the towers lounge was calm and with a great view. We did not eat at the hotel as there are lots of restaurants on the walk. Overall a great stay, friendly staff and a lovely relaxed feel compared to many of the other 5* hotels that think they are a bit special. Hope to be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: girlvicar
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Feb HT. On arrival I was told I would have to pay an extra £50 a night for an additional bed for my child, despite having booked a bed for him and paid the same price for him as the adults. I argued and they finally let me off, but it was a good start! The staff at the hotel are great, the pool area is great, but you cant help feeling its just a bit dated compared to other hotels in Dubai and it was not cheap. We ate one night in the Italian and it was terrible, awful, awful service, they advertised Pizzas that were not on teh menu as teh Pizza oven hadnt arrived and then an hour into service the waiters clocked off and we didnt see them for an hour, we had to pour our own wine and practically look in the kitchen for them to get our bill - I should add we were the only ones in the restraunt! We complained the next day, but the manager didnt seemt o care and nothing was done by way of an apology for the terrible dinner we had. Would I go back to Dubai, for sure, would I go back to teh Sheraton - NO WAY!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilby2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in late February and was disappointed. I found the heavy security presence (what for?!) at the hotel a bit much compared to other hotels I stayed in the Emirates and the decor dated. Breakfast buffet was average, rooms were clean and comfy, pool area and beach area were ok. I didn't like the hotel trying on using 'private taxi's' that would cost you more than a general cab. There is free internet usage in a cafe downstairs - only 2 computers for a large sized hotel. Maybe it's the Jumeriah area that is quite expensive, but the area itself didn't really appeal us as very touristy and therefore touristy prices were being charged.

Reviews.Title: “Sizzling Dubai”
Reviews.Author: kellyvp
Reviews.Content: We rented a car on arrival at Dubai airport and drove to the hotel. Check in was smooth and we were offered adjoining rooms. The valet parking for the car was absolutely God send. The rooms were spacious and well appointed with comfortable furnishings and entertainment offerings. The mini bar was fully stocked but slightly pricey. The hotel itself is one of the oldest on the Jumeirah strip and the architecture certainly lookes dated now compared to the sky scrapers surrounding it. There is a private beach with a life guard on duty till late in the evening and the pool area is absolutely immaculate with a lively cafe and a sunken bar in the pool. The staff are friendly and enthusiastic. The restaurant has a few renowned restaurants and the the service is excellent. Breakfast is a leisurly affair with a sumptuos offering and the omelletes created by the staff are divine. The concierge service is very knowledgable and offered valuable tips on excursions. I found the internet service a bit expensive and the period during the holy month of Ramadhan was a bit restrictive although the hotel tried its best to facilitate non - muslims. There was a charm and grace about the place was not at all impersonal like so many other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “CLASSIC 5* ELEGANCE”
Reviews.Author: LYNMCGLYNN
Reviews.Content: stayed 18th/20th december 2010 - fantastic. private beach, beer served on the beach all day, swimming pool georgeous, with swim up bar! tons of sunbeds, breakfast brilliant, 3 items of clothing ironed for FREE!! all staff brilliant and couldnt do enough for us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rough start, but staff made us forget about it all. Hope to return soon!”
Reviews.Author: Friso89
Reviews.Content: Got the chance to join my mom (with my boyfriend) to Dubai this Christmas and stayed at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Resort. First impressions: The hotel looks a bit outdated from the outside, but from the inside it's still a nice hotel. Another thing that's important is that the Sheraton is easy to reach during the entire day. The Walk can be quite busy (especially during the evenings) and hotels such as the Hilton are impossible to reach by taxi, because taxi-drivers seem to avoid The Walk at busy hours. Checkin: This was quite an ordeal. My mom was staying in another room and my boyfriend and I were sleeping in the same room. I guess the different surnames (and same gender) were a bit confusing for the reception staff? We booked a room with a kingbed, but the staff offered us a room with twin beds instead. We decided not to make a fuss about it and accepted the twin bedroom. Restaurants: We booked halfboard and it only included the Palm Garden (buffet)restaurant for breakfast/dinner. At first we were a bit disappointed, but the food was amazing and in the end we had no complaints about it at all. The only thing I would like to note, is that especially during breakfast, it got a bit cold at some tables, because people kept walking in-/outside (via the restaurant) which caused a bit of a (cold) draft at times. Hotelroom: Very clean and nothing special to report about it, except for the beds... I never slept this good in a hotel. Would really like to know what kind of mattresses they used! Oh and if you really want open a window at night, take a room with a balcony, because the other rooms don't have opening windows (as far as I know). Staff: Amazing staff, that's all I can say. Remembered our faces/room-number after the first day. Never experienced that before (eat that Club Med!). And we were greeted with a smile everytime (doesn't matter who it was). Definitely made me want to return to this hotel in the near future. Beach: Don't know much about the beach, as I spent most of my time in the city... Looked very clean, but you gotta be in good shape, because there's a huge drop between the beach and the sea (about 2 meters/6 feet). They fitted some stairs to make life easier, but you have to be careful. Overall: Had a rough start, but quickly forgot about it... thanks to the great staff! Hope to return in the near future. P.S.: To all the people who nag about Russian tourists. Maybe we were lucky, but they were all really nice and quiet during our holiday. Nothing negative to report about them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing & amazing”
Reviews.Author: MPA120769
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Dubai after a weeks holiday with my husband and 2 children aged 9 & 5.We stayed for 6 nights at the Sheraton and there isn't one thing that we'd change. The building works that were going on around the hotel and almost everywhere else in Dubai didn't bother us at all you could bearly hear them let alone see them.
