The hotel and grounds were immaculate and inpeccably clean and well presented, nothing was too much trouble, the staff were so attentive and always eager to please. There was always plenty of sunbeds available, Whatever you wanted or needed there was a member of staff within reach to assist you and they were only too pleased to help. On a whole we didnt find Dubai expensive and we went to both the Atlantis and Wild Wadi waterparks which were brilliant and to the malls on an evening. (the shops are more expensive than the UK but hey who goes all the way to Dubai to shop in UK High Street shops). There is an ice cream shop just as you enter the Atlantis which is brilliant for kids as they throw the ice cream around like cocktails and the selection is amazing. Taxis are very cheap and are readily available. The drivers are very respectful, helpful and polite. We had an amazing time at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach, we couldn't have asked for more from anyone who works there, their attention to detail is second to none. We will definatelty be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great staff”
Reviews.Author: frostfamily3
Reviews.Content: I agree with the positive reviews for this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in December, prior to Christmas. I can only say that all of the Staff were absolutely wonderful, so polite and courteous. They booked restaurants for us and an excursion to the desert, nothing was too much bother for anyone, even down to the freshly made hot chocolate for my son at Breakfast! One review mentioned about the beach being 'policed'. I saw the reason for this, and it only happens on the Friday's when it is the brunch'. If you are a non resident and go for the brunch you have two options, one being without beach access and one with. I saw on one occasion quite a large group trying to take advantage of the beach when they had not paid for it. I would say that this matter was dealt with discreetly and the staff were again always extremely polite. Yes there is currently building work next door and our room was next to this, but we never heard it at night or when the patio doors were closed. It was not a problem for us. By the way there is a lot of building work going on in Dubai in general. The room was lovely and clean and the patio was enormous with great views over the beach. We got the use of the Exec Lounge which was lovely. Their happy hour is one that should be taken advantage of as well as the snacks, which were gorgeous. Thank you to all the staff at Sheraton Jumeriah Beach for our lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: smowbray
Reviews.Content: After two days at the rather fabulous Westin we moved to the Sheraton for the remainder of our stay in Dubai. Despite booking a Towers the room was pretty basic - no duvets, bad lighting - generally in need of upgrading. Despite a very high room rate wifi was only available at a fee - a basic requirement these days. Nothing really wrong but feeling shabby and in need of a major facelift. The major building works next-door, although not the Sheraton's fault, were also unsightly and noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous !!!!”
Reviews.Author: shopland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for Christmas and can honestly say we all had a wonderul time, the hotel was immaculately decorated for christmas, the food was excellent with as much as you could eat. The staff were sooooo friendly and nothing was too much trouble, they all made such a fuss of the children. Our rooms were elegant and the linen was changed every day. We did'nt want to come home, but have already booked to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LandM58
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending Christmas in Dubai and had a fabulous stay at the sheraton. Wonderful food , wonderful rooms and wonderful service, nothing was too much trouble. Kids club was excellant as was the spa, look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Porsche777
Reviews.Content: We are living in Dubai since a couple of years and always enjoy the warm hospitatlity, very friendly service and excellent food at the Sheraton. Times have not been esay for the hospitality industry in Dubai and as a consequence a lot of hotels and restaurants started a cost cutting programme which resulted also in a reduction of the service and food quality. However, the Sheraton Jumeirah never ever compromised the excellent food quality and expecially events with big theme buffets are always a culinary highlight in Dubai. Sure there are more modern and posh hotels in Dubai but if you are looking for a great evening with friends with good service and excellent food "for a bill that does not kill" than you will enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous what a bitter disappoint”
Reviews.Author: hugieandguy
Reviews.Content: Expecting a five star hotel ...what a sick and expensive joke hotel old fashioned with appalling food , staff who couldn't care and to top it all a building site, which we weren't told about at the front and all the way down the left side of the hotel,unacknowledged by either the hotel or our travel company KUONI . The building site which started at 7 and finished late. Cranes overlooking the beach and a car park on the other side, both h visible and audible from every room. We were forced to move at additional expense to ourselves and after a horrific fight with KUONI. DONOT GO UNLESS YOU ENJOY THROWING MONEY AWAY BUILDING SITES

Reviews.Title: “What a shambles!”
Reviews.Author: ManavinDubai
Reviews.Content: Seemingly the only place in town serving a Thanksgiving Dinner, i reserved a table for three and was assured of a table over the phone. At the venue however, three of us were surprised to see a belly dancer and blaring arabic music; an arabic buffet and the remnants of a turkey. We were then, very nonchalantly, seated at a table for 8 and told by our waiter that this was the best they could do since it was 'so busy'. The chef very rudely told my son - "It will come soon", when asked how come there was no Turkey at a Thanksgiving Dinner. And we werent the only ones - it looked like they might have had a riot on their hands if another Turkey hadnt shown up. If this had been my local golf club i could understand but a 5 star property with such terrible service and rude comebacks based on being flustered is inexcusable. I hope Dubai comes up with better Thanksgiving options next year - this one was a total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Resort & Towers”
Reviews.Author: vikbhan
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Resort & Towers. Quite a nice hotel with great surroundings. Food is good in hotel with quite a nice room service. Very near to media city and internet city.Good shopping malls are also nearby.

Reviews.Title: “very much what I expected - no problems here”
Reviews.Author: ljwobker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while on a business trip. Just some thoughts: - the wifi is very expensive, was 100 AED per 24 hours. - the staff are all very polite, or at least the little bit I interacted with them - when leaving the hotel make sure you take a regular taxi rather than the hotel cars. Taxis are extremely cheap in Dubai, so even though the hotel cars may seem cheap they are often 2x-3x the cost of a standard metered cab. The hotel staff obviously encourage you to take their transport, but just politely refuse and make certain you're getting into one of the cream colored regular cabs. - the beach walk is right outside the hotel and features tons of restaurants and little places to shop. Only a few of these are super high quality food -- most of them are pretty generic chain places and random fast food places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - Service outstanding”
Reviews.Author: gooner69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during October and had an excellent junior suite with sea view. From the moment we arrived found the staff to be excellent and understanding of our needs. The weather was good and we had a great week. The details of the hotel in my opinion are as follows: The beach and pool - Very good pool and the pool boys sort out your needs. Towels always available and apart from towels being left on beds (when no need as always plenty available). The excellent swim up bar , but the only downside is the price of drinks (8 pounds a beer !!!) make sure you get some duty free's at Dubai airport on arrival to drink in the room.The beach does have a bit of a two tier with steps going from the upper level sand to the lower level. The sea was still very warm. Towers lounge - excellent staff ( Avrill leads the team very well) and lovely snacks and soft drinks all day. The happy hour (2 hours) is always a good chance for a drink and a chat with other travellers. Rooms- we had a great sea view and the beds were sooooooo comfortable we slept like lords. Hotel location - is superb next to the WALK - with plenty of resturants and shops etc.. Free bus is laid on to the Mall of the Emirates and should be booked a few days in advance to ensure a place. Metro system is very good and cheap Resturants - Chinese is very good but a little expensive. The buffet in the Palm Garden was very nice and had a variety of different main courses. "Overall an excellent stay with superb service from the staff" and will definately return next year for another week of fun in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice dining!”
Reviews.Author: Sina149
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 nights in this hotel in middle of my recent stay in Dubai. After trying almost all Starwood Chain hotels in the area, I can say this hotel had the most delicious dishes in room service and in the restaurants. If you want to stay in Jumeirah or Marina areas in Dubai, the location is good but if you need to be in the heart of Dubai like Diera or BurDubai, the hotel is too far from that area. Nice but very SMALL seaside area. Not all staff wearing smiles besides Front Desk people. They give me a complimentary lunch because of Gold SPG status and I've enjoyed the dessert more than main course. BEST SHERATON in DUBAI FOR SURE. I am saying this after trying other Sheratons in Dubai also!!!

Reviews.Title: “A real Oasis”
Reviews.Author: rksitaraman
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort for our weeklong stay in Dubai through SPG.com The Resort is a real "Oasis" The Staff were very friendly and receptive, especially Brian in the coffee shop. We were checked in smoothly by Hussain. My kids had a great time at the Pirate Club and were taken excellent care there by a girl from Sri Lanka (forgot her name) Our overall experience was excellent. My only request is that they have various type of pillows, since, the pillows provided to us were too thin and soft

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jajamaha
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Jumeirah Beach ramains one of the classiest hotels on Jumeirah Beach, indeed in Dubai and the UAE. One of the very few hotels in Dubai to have its own beach, the hotel caters to both business and leisure travellers. Good internet access in the lobby and executive lounge and plenty for the family to do around the pool and beach - there is also a children's play area (supervised) where parents can leave children over the age of four, while they relax. Food and drink is second to none and the rooms are spacious and typically comfortable. A special mention has to go to 4 members of staff for making our stay such a good one: Avril (exceptional in every way), John from the Executive lounge and both Allan and Salem by the pool (two great conversaltionists who are a real credit to the Sheraton Brand). Keep up the good work, we'll see you next year for the Cityscape exhibition again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, tries a little too hard”
Reviews.Author: Bodog35
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon at the Sheraton, slightly older than some of the other hotels but still very nice, i think it is a four star that is trying is best to be a five star, the service is very good and the little things they do like some days bringing cold towels around to the pool and always carrying your towels to the sunbeds show that they really want to be a five star but after visiting friends in the Atlantis this cannot be. We tried the snacks that are served at lunch and found them to be nice but expensive, we found that to walk to the supermarket across the road and buy a couple of sandwiches ( which we got told off for buy the pool bar manager) made a huge difference in price, the food served at the hotel would be worth it if just a little less expensive. I have marked them down on cleanliness as we were put in a smoking room (my wife smokes but is usually happy just to smoke on the balcony) with no balcony and the bedding smelled very stale,otherwise the room was ok. I have also marked them down on sleep quality as for three nights we had a very noisy group coming down our corridor at around 2am that hung about about an hour although this was no fault of the hotel itself. Overall a very nice hotel with lovelly gardens and beach just down the road from lots of restraunts and coffee shops and the staff are very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mr-van-Embricqs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel only for two nights before i moved on to other hotels in Dubai (i stayed in several 5* hotels during my trip) I asked if the room that i had booked had a balcony during check in and automaticly they gave me a room on the executive floor with a balcony with partial sea view en full JBR Walk view. Everything was nice,clean and modern in the room. Got a call in my room as soon as i checked in to ask me if the room was ok for me. And i don't know about the other rooms or whatever but the bed slept heavenly! I wanted to buy it but they wouldnt sell it to me.. Always spoken to with Mr and my last name.. Verry nicee beach!! Clean,neat and good service from mr Hari and Fransisco on the beach.. Nice garden with sunbeds and a full equiped gym in the building.. Located across the street from starbucks and the best bank in the UAE for exchange rates (Emirates Bank) Right on the JBR Walk where you can enjoy good food and drinks and the expensive cars show from drive by emarati's.. I needed to extend my checkout because of the late check-in to my next hotel.. Normally they charge you for that but i got it for free! I really have NO complaints about this hotel!! NONE! The front desk service was also excellent and pleasant.. Im used to luxury and ill be honest and say that i am a young spoiled boy.. But sheraton really lived up to my standards and expectations and me and my girl missed this hotel the most during our trip and stay in the other hotels.. This hotel is really the best hotel in the JBR area and way better than the no service, wannabe luxurious, no beach access Sofitel,Movenpick and even better than the Hilton and the Amwaj Rotana in the same street. Trust me, choose this one! And for the people who write that they got bad service and ugly rooms (we met some of them at the hotel)... Maybe it's your attitude and the way you behave yourself.. You get treated the way you treat people..What you get is what you deserve... I got the best treatment ;)

Reviews.Title: “Who cares for Hygiene? Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: FarooqKhan
Reviews.Content: It is said that nothing is like home when it comes to hygiene and Sheraton endorsed it very well on my last visit two weeks ago. Soon after checking in I discovered that the disposable glasses were stained with kind of whiskey or terrible odor liquid with drops of it inside and bottom of the glasses. The hotel staff would have wiped them with towels and placed for next stupid's use. Not all so carefully observe the hygiene in hotels but I had my two years old boy with me. I immediately checked rest of the things in the cabinet. The cups were dusty and stains of lips on the edge were clear. Again someone tried to cut the job short, instead of washing the cups, he/she would have cleaned it with a towel and placed back. I called the Duty Manager a young man who apologized and took away the dirty stuff replacing it with new and apparently cleaned stuff. I made it very clear to the duty manager that I need the five star Sheraton to take the responsibility of this third class hygiene but no one got back to me. At the time of check out, a lady calling herself the HEAD OF THE HOTEL at that time, blessed me with a discount by waiving the breakfast charges. I was totally disappointed by the way Sheraton took the responsibility of the situation. I asked her that I need Sheraton to compensate over and above that I have paid as FIVE STAR room rental but she refused by saying that this is the best SHERATON can offer you as compensation. I was so wrong to think that Sheraton will take full responsibility of this and waive my rental and compensate with free stays in other starwood hotels (naturally who wants to stay in the dirty five star with the kid again). Sheraton however waived one breakfast charges for my kid which I silently accepted due to very short time to reach airport. Thanks to my camera, I have taken pics of the dirty things. I would recommend this hotel for all those who are immune to dirty environment, those who just care about things apparently clean and those who just want to waste their money at a 5 star. Terrible customer relations and terrible housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to combine business with pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Vielflieger_44
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, cause its a bit out of town which gives you a more relaxed atmosphere where you can combine a business trip with a quick swim or beach. Direct access to the beach, great pools and a gym. Its just full of holiday makers: Germans, Brits and Russians...so be prepared. The Executive rooms are much better, a bit bigger and the lounge is very good. Excellent staff !

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely love this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Haysied
Reviews.Content: I was just reading other peoples reviews about the Sheraton Jumeriah and have to say that we have stayed at this hotel three times and we are going back for the fourth time on boxing day this year until Jan 2nd with our son this time. We are really excited about going back and just hope that our travel agent hasnt messed up our booking, as we have had many a problems trying to book this break away. If you are booking this hotel for new year, you will be charged for the Gala Dinner which is compolsory, however, our travel agent has charged us £130 more that the Sheraton charges which we are disgusted with, so becareful! See you in December Sheraton Jumeriah!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Midi82
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - albeit a little outdated Room: 3 nights in a Standard Room (with king bed); more than enough room for 2 people; room had a balcony and the bathroom was big enough; importantly - room was clean and air conditioning worked! Service: The service we received from the service staff (front desk, breakfast etc) was very good and polite and importantly were helpful when help was sought; no complaints here Food: only had the buffet breakfast which was very good (not quiteexcellent - as compared to other Sheraton buffet breakfast i've had; probably due to the smaller size of the breakfast area); definitely include the BB as part of your stay as there was enough variety and the food was fresh Location: in the heart of the tourist area with the hotel being the last hotel on the road; plenty of shops on the road the hotel is on; close enough to Mall of Emirates (15-20min by taxi), Atlantis (20mins), Burj Kalifa (30min); airport 30-40min (AED 65-75) Pool: didnt use the pool facilities; pool looked a little small given they had room to make it bigger; plenty of room and shade and sun-beds to work on the tan; beach is only a 2min walk from the hotel Overall: Had a very pleasant stay and would definitely stay here again TIP: if you plan to do Wild Wadi and Aquaventure (at Atlantis), go to Wild Wadi first; Wadi has more rides but found Aquaventure nice (as its bigger and newer).. plus it has the leap of faith which is cool - a must do!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant and wonderful stay, staff very hospitable and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Johnmitchfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed last summer at the Sheraton and found the whole experience a pleasant and thoroughly enjoyable one, the staff couldn't do enough to help us. We stayed for one week as a family with our special needs teenage son,our room was beautiful it suited our needs exactly and looked out towards the pool which was a nice bonus. The beach and pool areas were immaculate and staff always happy to help with anything. The hotel itself is quite central and never too far away from the many shopping malls in Dubai. We would highly recommend the Sheraton to any of our friends and look forward to going back again this summer. Many thanks ! Jacqueline Mitchell

Reviews.Title: “Much below par for a Sheraton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiccardoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Dubai and many Sheratons in other country's. I found some of the staff in the Sheraton Jumierah beach unwelcoming,unsmiling and in one case on the beach quite abrupt when I asked for a towel. The very poor room service was reported 3 times but not corrected. The food which arrived to the room was not the food which was ordered. The new pool table in the bar was rented by the hour for an outragous rate of 40 dh so a person wanting just a couple of games has to pay 40dh.I had just a few balls left to finish my last game in my hour, when the young barman said my hour was up and if carried on playing he would charge me another hour. The WiFi in coffee shop did not work every time. The hotel computers in the coffee shop did not operate when name and room number were put in. The hotel interior and grounds and location are excellent. Reception and coffe shop staf excellent. Riccardo valvona

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, average for holiday and business”
Reviews.Author: dragek
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice for business. It is located at the very end of the Jumeriah beach and my room always over looks a building site without a balcony. The room is ok, the Hilton next door is bigger, it has the basic hotel room facilities you would expect. Downstiars you have a couple of restaurants, once again, ok nothing special and a coffee bar which is nice, good coffee and is open 24 hours a day. It has free wifi and also computers top use in the coffee bar which is a big plus. The pool is small with a bar, the grounds are grassed and are very large and a welcome shade is greated by the numerous plam trees. The beach again is small and on a step slant and very crammed. It has a well equipped gym with squash courts and changing rooms, once again ok, a little worn. Staff are ok, nothing special and I had to complain as someone had messed up my booking and whilst ensuring twice my room was booked, reception called me on my last night at midnight to see whether I had checked out or not!!! Although I complained to the manager the next day, he took my business card and said he would look in to this and call me back, he never did! I wouldnt stay here out of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally hospitable, accommodating & professional staff; beautifully appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_NYC
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is beautifully appointed with virtually every possible amenity , it is the hotel's professional staff who make staying here truly enjoyable and memorable. Kudos to the General Manager and his team of professionals who ensure a first-class experience! This will definitely not be my last stay at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach Resort. As for the hotel's location, it is located within short walking distance to a pharmacy, banks, super market and various al fresco dining establishments serving everything from fast food to more upscale cuisine. These businesses are located in ‘The Walk’ at Jumeirah Beach Residence.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, affordable and relaxing all in one...best beach ever!”
Reviews.Author: DenikaRolle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10days with the expectations of not enjoying the hotel. That was changed by the people in the little cafe. They were so nice and everyone knew when they saw me, I would order an american coffee, sometimes 2. The conceirge guys were real nice and helpful. There is alot of food resturants on the walk so if you dont want to eat in the hotel you have lots of options on the walk. This was my first time in Dubai and i would definately be back !!!! The beach is reallly nice ....especially living in the Bahamas where it's hard to beat our beaches. The beach is on the end of the strip where there is more privacy, which was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Masafar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing to write home about. Rooms are mediocre, food is OK, and service is average too. The hotel really needs a refurbishment to bring into the same league as it's nearby competitors. Moreover, they do not seem to understand that "do not disturb" means I do not wanted to be disturbed - be it by phone or coming into the room!! The worst thing about this hotel is the senior management. I was asked about my stay, which I duly provided. However, they did not like what I said, and suddenly accuse me of using profane language and being vulgar. I raised this to the management, and was told the staff member has been here for 10 years, so we are sorry, and if you have an issue take it up with Starwood. For all readers of this, that comment was made by General Manager, Dany Dagher - who also comments on this site. Hence, if you want to go to a hotel where the management really do not care about their guests (and actually insult you) and rooms are sub-standard then stay here. Personally, I would advise you to avoid staying in this horrendous place. Dubai has many more hotels. As for Sheraton/Starwood, to have such a hotel in your group puts me off staying in any of your hotels - you need to select hotels which know how to provide service not ones like these with sub-standard management.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Less Luxurious than Other Dubai Hotels but Affordable”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, once with just me and my kids and once with the kids and my husband. It is probably the most affordable Jumeirah Beach resort and one of the smallest. For me, it was nice to be at a small hotel when I was alone with the kids because it makes it easier for me to keep an eye on them. However, when I travel with my husband, we chose other Jumeirah hotels. The buffet is affordable and nice. The staff in the restaurant is excellent and are especially kind to the children. The kids really enjoyed the buffet and found plenty to eat. I don't remember how much they charged for the kids' meals, but I know it was less than I was expecting to pay. The pool is basic by Dubai standards, but does have a nice swim-up bar where I enjoyed many cocktails and the girls had lots and lots of ice cream. The food at the bar was good. The kids' meals were so large that we quickly realized that we could order one meal and the girls could split it.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a good polish and in some parts sand-blasting!”
Reviews.Author: KCP_UK
Reviews.Content: I have been a visitor to Dubai for well over 10 years and this was my third 'leisure' stay on Jumeirah Beach. It started life as one of a handful along the beach and it has now been dwarfed by all the Beach Residence and new hotels that have sprung-up. It has made the transition from business to lesuire and to-date continues to achieve high occupancy with young families from the UK and continental Europe. Despite the exceptional occupancy rates, I have to question how much is being reinvested into the resort. The painted-over cracks are starting to re-appear and the beach is eroding. With SPG in hand, but no SPG desk operating, I was disappointed that my preferences were not entirely observed, despite writing to the management of the hotel. Due to the high occupancy we were not immediately afforded any form of upgrade, which is unusual, but to be fair and after some discussion with management, two days later we were finally upgraded to a Tower Room with a huge roof patio, sun loungers, table and chairs. The room was clean, well maintained and although the patio was not cleaned regularly it was safe for my young daughter to meander or sit in the shade. This was worth the wait. Because most of the other Starwood brands in Dubai are distant and reluctant franchisees, and I am talking about the two Meridiens, Grosvenor and the Weston at the marina end of the beach, there are no SPG options at any of these which is unfortunate. A good proportion of cardholders will thus book this place and maybe cash in some points. To those, a word of advice: on the SPG site this hotel was not bookable directly. Instead you are invited to call the CR number and you are advised that there are no rooms in the category but you are offered options for more points than Cat 4 - don't think, as I did, that it wasn't available. I did get fifth night free under current promotion so it all worked out fine. If you want to cash-in on SPG, don't rely on the website, make a call. On another note, there is seemingly no benefit at all to staying in a Tower Room. As management informed me on day-one, the rooms are "exactly the same, just higher up". Frankly 'Tower' is a misleading description as it is only a 10 storey building. The so-called upgrade that SPG members should expect however is 'tower access' this means very little frankly and should NOT be put forward as an upgrade. 'Tower Access Upgrade' does not mean a Tower Room as I discovered. In fairness as SPG you will get breakfast included as part of your upgrade too and an option to have this in the 'Tower Lounge' as opposed to the main food hall. The Tower Lounge Breakfast where we ate a couple of times, is a cut-down buffet with about 20 tables. This gets very busy and seemingly all guests access the lounge without challenge. So all guests appear to have 'run-of-the-house'. If you stayed here on business, you would be infuriated by this! At 10:30 SHARP!!! the burners are removed and a crew in boiler-suits dismantle the buffet very abruptly. You are given a longer breakfast lease in the main hall (until 11) but... ...there the staff are completely burned-out and service has seemingly collapsed. This was a big disappointment. The breakfast service is anything but five-star. I was absolutely astonished when I went for a basic omlette at the cooking station and despite an enourmous basket of eggs beside the chef, my omlette was prepared by premix egg from a cardboard carton hidden in the corner of the griddle. Imagine that! Whoever allows this to go on should join the Motel 6 chain in the excited states and any food tech that pours premix egg from a box should also consider a career change! I would much rather do it myself. We stayed 6 nights altogether and breakfast was always the soucre of major irritation regardles of what time we dined. I asked for coffee and was directed with a flick of the nose 'over there' to a pot of coffee on a service stand. Asked for milk and it was lifted from a spent table. At the stroke of 10:40 it is 'last orders' at the buffet(!) and the bolier-suits re-appear to 'breakdown the breakfast' with the panache of a herd of starved elephants. My advice is therefore book room-only! The breakfast is not worth bolting from your holiday morning slumber for - that is for sure! A serious critique is needed internally to re-invent the maninstream F&B. We did not bother with the other outlets. It is a busy hotel that is clinging on to the coast (literally) in the face of new giants glaring down at them. Direct Beach Access and mature landscaped gardens with shady palms make-up for the other kinks I suppose, it is safe enough for children but you must watch them at all times because there is a mostly empty seat where the lifeguard should be. The other pool staff were very friendly and excellent at clearing out vacated loungers to find you agood spot. The swim-up bar is really just a place they keep the beer fridge - you need to shout loudly to get service from the other side where the dining area is and the music is blasting in your face. It is cowded too because they supplement the leisure facility with 'members' who reside elsewhere in Dubai and come to use the pool and beach. Five out of Ten with compliments to very busy front desk staff, pool deck staff and efficient handlers at the front door. Avoid anything other than direct sea-facing rooms because of Marine Club being constructed on a wedge of land next to hotel which when we stayed had completed some ground works and was starting to go vertical. Beyond that it is Jebel Ali's industrial coast. Could do much much better in this prime location and only for families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired...but you're right on the water....”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Jumeirah for 4 nights in March 2010. I selected the property because I stayed in the neighborhood previously. Regrettably, I do not recommend this property. Date wise, it is quite old, and the interior is a bit tired. The service was hit or miss, primarily miss. Undoubtedly, there are nicer properties along the beach. As usual, The Good, The OK/Bad, and The Ugly The Good - Location. Right on the water and on a strip with countless restaurants and a collection of shops. If you like the water and plan to spend most of your time at the beach, then this spot should be on your list. - Beach facilities. While regrettably I did not use them, the facilities looked great. They had nice chairs and a large private beach area both on the sane and in a lawn area surrounded by leafy palm trees. The guests had their choice of sun or shade. - Outdoor cafe. We stopped in and had a drink one night. While the staff was slow, the setting was nice. The OK/Bad - I arrived about 00:30 (which is normal for Dubai) and my room was not ready. I find not excuse acceptable for not having my room ready at this hour. I waited for about 45 minutes and then was shown my room. On a side positive note, the front desk manager apologized, and offered me a complimentary drink in the bar. - The room. It was OK, but a bit dated as is the entire property. While my room had two beds, the one I slept in was comfortable and kept clean by the staff. The bathroom was fine space wise but had seen it's better days. The room did include a nice working desk. - Fitness center. Outdated, used equipment fills this space. While a nice amount of room, and a good selection of weights and machines, the elliptical machines were actually converted from bicycle machines and most settings simply did not work. It is clear that the management team had not spent time investing in this area. The Ugly - At checkout, I was asked if I used the mini-bar the night prior. I had - a Diet Coke. The employee called a colleague to check to ensure I was being honest. The same thing was happening to another gentleman checking out beside me. After about 10 minutes of waiting, I said "enough." It's a can of soda that costs 15 Durhams. My bill was about 100 times that amount. It left a poor taste in my mouth and completed a "book end" that reflected my check-in. These two episodes will keep me from returning. - Expensive WiFi service that was spotty at best. While I don't like it, I accept that some properties charge for WiFi. BUT...if a property is going to charge, the least it can do is have acceptable service. Thumbs down Sheraton. - Breakfast experience. On the first morning (the only morning I ate breakfast) I came down at about 07:00. Upon selecting the buffet, I learned the chef was not yet there to make omelets and the like. Why not? If your breakfast begins at 06:30 and you advertise a chef - then that person should be there, or a substitute. The buffet was OK, nothing special. - From breakfast I should have learned, but one afternoon after some meetings a colleague and I wanted lunch. So we stopped in the lobby restaurant. A mistake. We both ordered a pastrami sandwich. I understand I am in Dubai and did not have high expectations, but being in the Sheraton, I thought the sandwich had a chance. How I was wrong. No kidding, the sandwich had a single slice of pastrami. I couldn't believe it and asked for the check. When the hostess asked if everything was fine, I said "no" and explained. She smiled and proceeded to do nothing. Hey Sheraton - if you are training your employees to ask questions, also train them to handle the answers. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Our holiday in this hotel was fantastic and we would return”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshireLinda
Reviews.Content: All the staff we met were professional, very friendly and extremely helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Everything was very clean and nicely maintained. We ate in the Grill several times and the food was absolutely delicious. We also used the spa where the massages were great, really relaxing. We used the Towers Lounge every day and the staff were fantastic. There were lots of restaurants and shops in the locality and plenty of taxis if you wanted to venture a little further. We went in March and the weather was gorgeous. We had a fantastic holiday and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Wendy_Philip
Reviews.Content: Big enough to have everything, small enough to be friendly, clean, good food, on the beach, own gardens, friendly staff, and in February - just perfect for a one week chill out. I even vowed to go back every February.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth staying”
Reviews.Author: norttim
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolutely great. Unlike some have written, our experience was that the staff was very friendly and much more polite than ever in Finland. The service was perfect. Especially the staff of the restaurants ( beach bar, moods, azure etc. ) was amazing. It is true that the building itself is little old but that did not bother us. I think that the most important thing is the cleanliness and friendly staff. you never know that your gonna get when you book a hotel but this time we got it right. If I would have to say something " bad " about the hotel, it would be the prices that were so very expensive. It was not really possible for us to eat there. The quests wouldn`t necessary go eat outside if the prices was more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JoHovean
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February. It was my first trip to the Emirates so didn't know what to expect. The place in general was akin to Canary Wharf in the summer, but if you can see beyond skyscrapers, chain stores and shopping centres you'll find a great mix of cultures working alongside each other pretty well. The weather in February was tolerable - kids can play on the beach without fear of sizzling after 15 mins, and milky white people like myself have no fear of burning. The staff at this hotel were very helpful and friendly. I'd recommend it if you want to spend lazy days on the beach, take a stroll at lunch time (loads of inexpensive restaurants on the doorstep), and maybe wander a little further into the city in the evenings. The only downsides was the distance to the city centre - we had to take cabs absolutely everywhere. The rooms were clean and tidy, but need updating if they want to attract return customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Home from home.”
Reviews.Author: scotscalder
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, it was great, wish we were still there instead of being back in the cold North of Scotland. Staff were first class and so good to our we Granddaughter. Clean and comfortable rooms with everything we could wish for. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location by the beach”
Reviews.Author: heilio
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel and a great location by the beach. Probably one of the best hotel beaches in town.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton was a pleasent stay”
Reviews.Author: boston06
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the negative reviews I was concerned, but upon my arrival, untill I left I was left wondering where these people stayed. I found it was superb for service, the food was excellent, the beach was good and plenty of sunbeds. The location may be a problem for some people but it suited me. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it while you can”
Reviews.Author: asialoverR
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location for dining and outing, place is pretty old and torn, furniture in rooms are old, I agree with previous reviews , reception staff very unfriendly, namely Mustafa, and Hussain, they both lack smile, attitude and courtesy, Ahmed in the evening shift little better, I always stay in starwood hotels in Dubai and worl wide but the reception staff in SJB is horrible, I suggest the management to keep Asian staff front liners as atleat they have the smile and more polite, and the others are ok for the back office. For the price I paid I could have stayed in Sofitel or Hilton few meters away, at check out they wanted to add Evian water 30AED to my bill insisting that I consumed it, I went upstairs and saw it in the room beside the TV, so they couldn't argue I admit, staying there was a mistake will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For a Holiday Maybe !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mattman40
Reviews.Content: Good spot, although I wouldn't have known the sea was there if I hadn't ventured up to the Club Lounge, my view was of a building site. As a business hotel it doesn't work, its small and the staff looked stressed at all stations, particulalrly on reception, where whilst I was checking out the Manager was busy barking at one of the staff, for what I have no idea. For a holiday maybe, because it is on the beach, albeit a man made strip of sand, don't expect the Maldives, style. Location is good, five minute walk to some thing of a promenade. Main probelm,....... the rooms, I am a SPG Platinum, and was told with much pomp I had been upgraded, to what at best can be descirbed as a three star Motel style room with a view of a very large hole in the ground next door. Also quick tip, beer from Mini bar is 40 somehting AED for a can, so grab a six pack on duty free. If on business, there are much better choices, if on holiday at the right rate,.... maybe !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MariaSvenOlovSoneby
Reviews.Content: I booked a room as a treat for our son and his fiancée. It was their first time in Dubai and I knew that they would love to stay at a place with a beach and near to restaurants and cafés (The Walk) . They loved every minute of it, they were complimented with wine, fruit and chocolates and with a fantastic service, they were overwhelmed by the kindness and generosity of the staff. Thank you Mr Dagher for making their stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Never 5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Farleywillow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived back yesterday after spending New Year in Dubai. This was our first stay at the Sheraton. On previous visits to Dubai we have stayed at the One and Only Royal Mirage which is also a 5* hotel. After having experienced both there is no comparision. How the Sheraton can be rated 5* is a mystery. Check-in - we arrived early morning after travelling throught the night. We had emailed to ask if we could check in early but when we got to the desk (8.30am) we were told there were no rooms available and to come back at noon. We were not offered a welcome drink or anywhere to wash up/change. The receptionist never cracked a smile and looked thoroughly miserable. We then spent the next 3 hours wandering around the hotel with our hand luggage trying to find somewhere to rest in the end we fell asleep still in the clothes we had travelled in on a sunlounger. There is a weird 'one way' system in operation whereby you are not allowed to walk through the hotel to the beach - there is a security guard on the door who sends you outside via the spa even if you are a hotel guest! When we asked him why we couldn't go throught the door he said it was 'hotel policy' (Throughout our stay whenever we went outside we were asked by security if we were hotel guests- drove us mad after a while) When we went back to reception at noon we were handed the room cards but no explanation of where anything was etc. we had to ask how to get to our room! The personal service found in other hotels we have visited was seriously lacking at the Sheraton. Any communciation we received to our room was generic mass produced information addressed to 'Dear Hotel Guest' . With the exception of the ladies in the coffee bar and the cleaners the staff were unhelpful and miserable. We asked the concierge for details of the shuttle service to the malls, he barely looked up as he handed us a sheet with times but didn't offer any further information. The hotel itself is in serious need of updating, the reception area looks like it was last decorated in the 1970's. There is a major building project going on next door so the view is not good - mainly of cranes! The restaurants - On the first night we ate in the chinese restaurant which was nice but expensive and then we had three evening meals in the main buffet restaurant. This was fine the first time but the next two times when we arrived approx 9pm (restaurant is supposed to close at 11pm) the staff were already clearning up - there were no salad plates, no dessert bowls and the chef had disappeared so we ended up carving our own meat and helping ourselves to what was behind the counter! Also, when we returned to our table after fetching our desserts the waiter had cleared the table of cutlery and water! Not what you would expect from a 5* hotel and it wasn't cheap - between 190 - 220 dhs per person. You can find much better food and service if you go out of the hotel and choose one of the many restaurants on the 'walk' The room we stayed in was fine, although we overlooked the building site. It was cleaned to a good standard. The gym is fine and we used it most days during our stay, however there is no attendant to stop the children playing on the equipment as they did every evening we were there. Three times when we used the gym there were no towels and we had to go and ask for them. The beach - this was a tiny patch of sand crammed with white plastic sun loungers. It was supposed to be a private beach, however the hotel allows non-hotel residents to use it for a price so we were crammed in like sardines. You have to go and fetch your own towels and sign them out - we have never come across this at any other 5* hotel we have visited. The beach was plagued with flies too, attracted probably by the many yellow rubbish bins spread all over the beach. The beach bar 'Azure' was a wooden shack with a couple of fridges in it. New Year's Eve - there was a 'gala dinner' arranged and this worked out at an additional 2400dhs (£430.00) on top of what we had already paid for the hotel room. We chose not to participate, however what no one told us that all the other restaurants in the hotel closed because of the gala dinner and security prevented anyone going outside where the event was taking place unless they had booked. Because no one had explained this previously we hadn't booked anywhere in advance so ended up having room service at 11.30pm!! All in all our stay at the Sheraton was very disappointing. Our experience was by no means 5* Unfortunately we didn't look at the reviews on Trip Advisor before we booked or else we would have chosen somewhere else. If you are looking for exceptional service, beautiful surroundings, wonderful food and happy staff do not go to the Sheraton Hotel, instead pay a little extra and go to the One and Only Royal Mirage - that's where we will be returning to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Value for Money - Unclean Rooms - Not at all 5*”
Reviews.Author: cosmoproletVienna
Reviews.Content: I was staing in Dubai for vacation and chose this property because of the location on the beach and the possibility to redeem my points. Arriving at 2am check-in was smooth. Then however the trouble started. The room was quite ok, however nothing luxurious. The problem was that the bath-tub was not clean upon arrival. It contained hair and other leftovers from former guests. When the front desk called to check if everything was ok, I told them about it and they offered me to change the room. I refused since we had already unpacked and just asked them to assure proper cleaning the next day. On the next day I went to the room after breakfast and this time the sink was dirty, no drinking water was provided and some towels were missing. I went down to the front desk to complain. The lady noted everything and promised that it would not happen again. No apologies. Given the fact that I had to pay EUR 350 per night after I had redeemed my points I think one should be able to expect a properly cleaned room especially in a so called 5*. The next day the bath-tub was dirtier than ever before. This time the front desk contacted the housekeepeing manager so I could complain directly. The housekeeping manager was "very sorry" and promised better cleaning. After that (three days after arrival) the room was properly cleaned for the first time. Another problem at this hotel is the pool bar. They only have deep fried items at a ridicolous price on the menu. The staff is inattentive and not very friendly. Choice and quality of the food is three star level in the best case. Also you would not expect 10 year old plastic sun-loungers at a 5* hotel charging you 350 EUR per night. The only good things about this hotel are the friendliness of the staff of the Towers Lounge, The Grill Room (had fantastic if pricey dinner there) and the beach I would not return given the bad value for money. I am currently staying at the Grand Hyatt which is a benchmark for excellent service and quality at the same price-level.

Reviews.Title: “A DECENT 4 STARS BUT NOT WORTHY OF 5”
Reviews.Author: StevieG489
Reviews.Content: I’m sure the Sheraton JBR was a 5 star hotel 10 years ago but it seems to be clinging on to those stars mainly by virtue of its location. Having booked the hotel as part of a package deal I’m quite glad I didn’t pay 5 star prices! Hotel – the hotel is quite small by Dubai standards compared to others such as the nearby Hilton hotel. There are (I think) 4 restaurants (one 24hr), a bar, a top floor lounge and a coffee shop. I used the gym facility once and it was perfectly adequate for most purposes with modern equipment and free weights. The lobby area has a corridor leading to a small convenience shop, a hairdresser, sauna/massage room and a squash court. Location – the location is fine if you want to be in the Jumeirah beach area. However, it is less convenient if you want to take regular trips to the centre of the old city. My taxi journey from the airport worked out at about GBP15 including the airport surcharge; GBP11 on the return leg. Both journeys took about 30 minutes with no traffic delays. I had no problems getting taxis as they queue up outside the hotel, even at 7am. Perhaps if I had been leaving at 4 or 5am I would have considered booking one. The Mall of The Emirates shopping centre is 10 minutes drive and the hotel has a free shuttle service which leaves about 3 times a day. It also serves the Ibn Battuta Mall. You are required to book this service as there are limited spaces on the bus. Restaurants – as a solo traveller, and on a budget, I tended not to use them. There are lots of cheaper alternatives nearby including some well-known chains: KFC, Pizza Hut, Pizza Express, Subway, Starbucks etc. Ideal if you dont wish to splash out GBP35 every night. There are also many independent Italian, Mexican and Asian restaurants to choose from. Room – check in is 3pm. I arrived early (2pm) and was offered a smoking room as an alternative to my 'not ready room'. Note to non-smokers: DO NOT ACCEPT A SMOKING ROOM! I inspected one and it was terrible! A non-smoking room was a big improvement but had the feel of a 4 star room than a 5 star. I didn’t use the mini bar as the prices were crazy – GBP3 for a chocolate, GBP8 for a small can of beer, GBP5 for a small bottle of water. You get the idea. I had a land view room which overlooked a building site. Not a problem for me as there wasn’t much noise. My room had a (locked) interconnecting door to the room next door. I could hear a lot of noise from the neighbours whose child had a habit of shrieking every 5 minutes! A bit annoying especially on the first night when it woke me up. Breakfast – this takes place from 6:30-11am and don’t even think about getting there after 9am! I recommend no later than 8am. The café cannot cope with the volume of people and it’s like feeding time at the zoo! I found the food below the standard expected for a 5 star and have experienced better at 2 and 3 star hotels. The usual offerings were available: pastries, yoghurt, tinned and fresh fruit, cereals. The cooked items looked unappetising – orangey looking (rather than yellow) scrambled eggs etc. Even the tea and coffee were a little disappointing. Internet – there is no free service but if you switch on your laptop the wireless will connect you to the Starwood Resorts internet login where you will be asked to pay about GBP5 for 30minutes, GBP9 for 60minutes, or GBP17 for 24 hour access. What a joke. I ended up visiting a nearby café, buying a coffee for GBP2 and using their free internet service. Staff - no real problems except sometimes they appear disorganised. For example, a second housekeeper visited my room shortly after someone else had cleaned it. Pool/Beach– the pool is quite small but there was an adequate number of sun loungers to cater for most people. Again, the beach is quite small. All in all I would say the hotel is fine if you go with the expectation of a 4 star and only pay 4 star prices. It is ideal for someone just looking to sit by the pool for a few days and do a bit of shopping. If you are more into culture I'd advise staying somewhere nearer the Creek.

Reviews.Title: “luxuary at it's best”
Reviews.Author: surfergirl93
Reviews.Content: NOT the most affordable hotel. butttt, very worth it. not a single detail was left out. and we were satying in the club rooms which does work out as more expensive, but also more fun. you get alot more complementary items. like breakfast, cocktails and sancks and free goodies kept at the front desk. if going with family, they'll love it! the hotel is closer to ibin batuta mall than to the mall of emerits although a trip shuld be made to both. the view is brilliant from any point in the hotel. it is directly on the beach and it is faboulous to look into the ocean, then just turn around and look at one of the most high rising cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull Service with untrained reception staff”
Reviews.Author: rezafan
Reviews.Content: The reception staff of Sheraton Jumeirah Beach in Dubai is very unfriendly, they are unable to provide the level of service you expect. Don't forget to have minimum three times a written cancelelation confirmation, otherwise you have to pay for the mistake of untrained reception staff. There are other hotels with better service and perfect hospitality. I don't recommend this hotel at all. This was my worst experience i made ever with hotels in Dubai and i was many times in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: tools99
Reviews.Content: Absolute Luxury beyond your wildest dreams, I had Club level and the food was amazing, the pool bar is SWEEEEEEEEEEEEET!! go for it and don't think twice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Marina District - Room Decor needs an update though”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoy being the last hotel at the end of the Marina district in Dubai. This is enviable because the view is better and it is more quiet this way. The shops and restaurants are still close by so when you need that, it is just steps away. WiFi is kind of expensive (100 AED for 2 hours) but your PIN code allows you access anywhere on the property. I did not eat in the hotel because there were so many options in the marina itself so I cannot speak to the food quality. Room had a great view of the ocean and the horizon. Decor is dated however. Felt like a late 90s era and could use some updating. TV was an LCD Flat Panel. You need to request an iron and board - only includes those awkward pants pressers in the closet. Room includes a safe. Bathroom was decent - shower/tub and lots of amenties. Weak point - the towels are small, old and there were not enough of them. Concierge and doormen were great! Very helpful. Cash machine on site. Small but decent gym. They also had 2 raquetball courts in the hotel. And there are separate mens and women's sauna/steam faciities for after your workout. They have a business enter but you need to use yor WiFi PIN to access the internet there too. Good for printing boarding passes etc. I also used one of the hotel cars to Dubai airport - in this case, the rate was very reasonable (140 AED) and I didnt want to take the chance of sitting in traffic with a metered taxi. All in all I liked the property and would stay there again for a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Above expectations .... by a long way!”
Reviews.Author: RedRuss50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the first week of Nov 09 with my wife and I have to say, in all honesty, I could not find fault, indeed, once the manger (Danny Dagher) knew I was celebrating my 50th b'day and my 25th wedding anniversary, not only were we upgraded at no extra cost but a bottle of wine and a celebratory cake were left in our room! The staff were couteous and friendly in all areas of the hotel. The pool area (do not take towels, not needed!), beach and gardens of the hotel were of the highest quality. I know we were upgraded but the hospitality ofered in the Towers corporate area would have been worth paying extra for. Hotel a bit out of the way which in my mind was a bonus. Taxis to pretty much everywhere were easily arranged and the price always came to £5, including a tip (slightly more when we went to the Creek area). I would definitely stay here again without hesitation! Must visit - the bar on the 63rd floor at The Address hotel for views to die for!

Reviews.Title: “quite impressed”
Reviews.Author: LJCM
Reviews.Content: clean, practical hotel, good attentive staff. The location is mixed. It is on the edge of jumeira beach and taxi's are hard to come by in the evening. Plenty in the daytime. Outside the hotel there is a lovely strip of lots of restaurants and a small night market. The beach is very good, clean , shallow and very pleasant. They have a free bus to Emirates Mall. I would consider saying here again. Rooms were clean and spacious. we a 2 queen beds for a family of 4 which was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, chilled dining room, housekeeping wake you up in the middle of the night”
Reviews.Author: janetinabudhabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the Starwood promotion where you earn free nights. they would only give us the cheapest room, without a view and they were very unaccomodating to any of your wishes. Went to the steakhouse grill for dinner. Ordered the combo seafood platter which I would not recommend. My husband had the surf and turf and the steak was just excellent! Skipped the wine---starting price $24 US per glass. Unfortunately, us and the other diners rushed our meal here as the place was just freezing. Again when we asked if this could be adjusted were flatly told that it was the lowest the ac could go. We went and had a great coffee and dessert in the adjacent open cafe and felt much better treated here where the staff were much more accomodating. Toilet in the room did not flush properly and while we were out it was repaired. Later we returned and went to sleep. Staff phoned us and woke us at 11 pm to see if the problem had been repaired satisfactorily.Drinks and room service are extremely expensive here. Breakfast is approx. 32-40 $ US. so we opted to pick up coffee and fruit salad from the coffee bar for a more reasonable sum. The beach is great here and while the pool is a bit dated, it still is a great place to suntan on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kireland09
Reviews.Content: After making our booking we read some of the reviews about the Hotel and had resigned ourselves to staying in a very basic Hotel but we were pleasantly surprised. We arrived early in the morning and were given our room even though official check in is 3pm. (much appreciated after an overnight flight). The Front Desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was spacious, clean and nice decor. There was some building work going on across the road but whats new in Dubai? New Buildings everywhere. This was not a problem for us as we do not spend a lot of time in our room. The Pool area was very nice and the staff were friendly and efficient. During our stay there was a promotion for the Hotel restaurants 50% discount for residents this was great value and the food in The Grill and The Peacock was very good. If you are not a City person this is the Hotel for you as there is a great selection of restaurants and cafes opposite the Hotel known as 'The Walk'. The free bus to the Malls was a very nice touch.The staff in particular Housekeeping, Customer Service and Front Desk were friendly, efficient and professional. A special thanks to the Manager and Security who went to great lengths to get my purse back which I had left in a Taxi. We requested a Late checkout and were accommodated as we had a very late flight. Overall our stay was a very pleasant and relaxed one and we would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous girly holiday”
Reviews.Author: louisebaker123
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel approx 4 years ago, and this holiday was a last minute option which arose so i checked out prices of all beach hotels and this came up the best cost, so decided to go back. after reading many of the reviews on here, was a bit aprehensive, on arrival though all was as i left it 4 years ago, luxurious, fab rooms, good service and hot weather! we did have a problem on check in but stood by our guns and eventually got what we wanted, an upgraded towers room. our room was gorgeous, great sea view, palm island view, servicing was brilliant and we were celebrating a birthday so also had chocolate cake and fruit. needed hangers and extra towels, were delivered within minutes. we also used the spa here, which was fantastic, highly recommend it! location....it is one of the furthest from the city, 30 mins but there are shuttle buses to some malls, or do a big bus tour?? taxis were always available outside door. the best malls to go to are....dubai mall, ibn battuta mall, deira city centre mall, mall of emirates. we also went to the gold souk and karama for all those good fakes too!! all in all, fab holiday and was upgraded to business class on emirates on the return flight which was a good job as we were 12 kgs over weight with all our spending!!!! definately choose this hotel, in fact i dont think you ll have a bad hotel anywhere in dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay with very friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: adlima
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a fantastic 5 night stay at the Sheraton Jumeirah Beach resort. Having read some of the reviews here about the hotel I was a bit apprehensive about staying here but I really enjoyed my stay. One would often wonder do some people go out of their way to find fault with everything? The staff were very pleasant, extremely helpful and at times, really went out of their way to help us. The rooms were comfortable and very well air-conditioned. The beach was fantastic as are the gardens and the pool. There were always plenty of sun loungers available and there was always a member of staff nearby. Although the hotel is situated abouts 20mins from the city, this did not bother us one bit as taxis are very cheap. We came to Dubai to enjoy the heat and relax so it was nice that we were away from the city while still having everything we needed beside us. For anyone thinking of staying at the Sheraton Jumeirah, you will have a very pleasant stay. Don't let some of the reviews here put you off. I may be back in Dubai in November and I hope to stay in the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints what so ever”
Reviews.Author: dougpauc
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my partner and I have vacationed in the UAE and stayed in any hotel there. As such the trip was part holiday and part exploration. We heard so much about Dubai that we had to see what all the fuss was about and after reviewing comments on this website booked with the Sheraton on HB basis. A few reviews mentioned that travellers had issues with the board basis but simply emailing the hotel prior to the visit stopped any issues there. We also asked for a double and the staff managed even this request. As a rule my partner and I eat out alot and so invariably you visit other hotels. Most of the good restaurants in Dubai are situated in hotels so in eating out you also see what other holiday makers are getting and experiencing. And after staying for ten days we visited and ate in alot of hotels and so can give a fairly balanced view. The Sheraton is clean, quiet (no screaming unruley kids running amok), the food is as good as I've seen and better for buffet style meals while the Peacock chinese restaurant is excellent. The grounds are nice and well kept, there is always sun beds available and most importantly the staff are polite and accomodating. The beach is man made and like most of the area's around Jumeriah there is very little sea life. Dont expect Red Sea flora and fauna. For this you need to go down to Mussadam, Oman. As for internet access I was slightly put off by the fact that the Sheraton charge. All over Dubai there are WIFI hotspots that are free - so why charge. So if you can take the netbook and go across the road to Starbucks, buy and coffee and download. To finish I would recommend this hotel for couples, those with very young children or anyone who likes to relax through the day rather than listen to a riot. if you want that go to Jumeriah Beach- its like a large creche-playschool. Go for dinner at the Hilton Dubai creek and eat at Verre - its excellent. Go for a drink at the Barj, but the food and service for the "flight dinner" is inconsistant and not worth the GBP180 per head they charge. Instread rebook with Girly the maitredee at Verre and go again. PD

Reviews.Title: “nothing special, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Valeryantoaneta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite far from the city. The only road leading to d city is very busy and you would be in traffic for at least 30 minutes before getting on Sheik Zaet Road. Same when you are going back to the hotel. Currently the hotel is surrounded by huge construction site - quite noisy and dusty. This was April/May 2009 so if you plan on going anytime in 2009 it's gonna be the same mess around. Reception staff is not as polite as one would expect. front desk manager even quite rude compared to other staff. You cannot get anything complimentary - they charge you a lot. Hotel cabs are overpriced, although they say it isn't, its double the price of a call cab. The nice thing about it is the palm garden with a nice restaurant, good food and a pool site. Pool is cold though, not heated around 25 C. And mind the mosquitoes at night - I got bitten up at least by ten for 20min walk in the evening in their garden.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to hire staff and....”
Reviews.Author: TrueBlueMoo
Reviews.Content: Totally understaffed, which result in sub-sub-par service. I spent a 3 night long weekend here - first time staying at this hotel. Checked in a 10pm. There appears to a serious shortage of staff - Here is a summary of the first 2 hours I was in the hotel. 1). Tried to check in, and there was one staff member at the desk, with a line-up of 3 guests waiting. There was no one at the Preferred Guest Check-in. Check-in took 20 minutes. 2). Arrived at my room, and called Customer Service TWICE to have my bags brought up. I gave up after 50 minutes and walked down and got it myself. There were 3 staff members picking their noses beside my luggage. WTF? 3). The free bottle of water in my room was open. Yuck. What else are they skimping on? I phoned customer service, requesting a new bottle, which they promised (along with my luggage). Nothing every happened. 4). Went down to the hotel bar - it was busy, but there appeared to be only 2 staff trying to service the whole bar. I gave up after 10 minutes without even successfully making eye contact with a staff member.

Reviews.Title: “Never. Ever Again.”
Reviews.Author: KamiD
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER EVER step foot within 100 miles of this sham hotel again. 1. It ruined my holiday. 2. We paid for a private car transfer - the driver didnt even bother to wheel our luggage for us. Two young women were left to wheel their own luggage, if i wanted to wheel my own luggage i could have got a taxi for 1/6 of the price! 3. We arrived at 9am, having requested early check in to be told that our room would not be ready until 3pm.Nor were we advised that we could freshen up someehere, nor were we offered even a sip of water to drink. All the "duty manager" - kannan had to say was that there were other people waiting too and that he 'didnt care' 4. I requested to see the Hotel Manager who turned up at 11am. To be fair Mussafa was a reasonable gentleman and offered to upgrade our room. Too little, too late.( We were also repsented with a bottle of wine and fruit platters on a daily basis - I would rather have got my holiday off to the right start) 5. The Pool - The staff were pleasant enough but for some reason unbeknown to me - did not once in 11 days offer to lay our towels on our loungers, yet when any other visitor came to they pool they couldnt be more helpful. 6.The restaurant - Indian was on the menu everyday. Repetitive to say the least. Breakfast was nothing to write home about.The wine was EXTORTIONATELY priced for glorified vinegar. The wait staff were so prejudiced. We tried to go into the 'restaurant' to eat after having visited the pool. Fully clothed. We were advised that we needed to go and change as pool attire was not acceptable in the restaurant, low and behold the next day, at the same restaurant i see 4 italian tourists sitting on napkins. Not only were their clothes 'pool clothes' but they were ALSO SOPPING WET. 7. The security guy - THE BIGGEST JOKE OF THE HOLIDAY. We mistakenly left our shoes inside one morning and only realised once it was too late and we were on concrete which had been warmed by the 45degree heat. With burning feet we tried to re enter the lobby wearing bath sheets in order to pick up our shoes. The security guard claimed that it was against the law to allow people in swimwear to enter the lobby. So we eventually had to wait 15mins to get the hotel manager to come and allow us 'special permission to enter the lobby'. This was relatively early on in the holiday and i went on to see all manner of inapproriately dressed individuals entering the lobby on a daily basis. 8. Also the hotels location is rubbish, right at the very end of the Jumeriah Beach Boulevard. Too far from everything. The best thing about this hotel were the concierge. So polite, friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here please”
Reviews.Author: Ellie06Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon, and the service received was so bad it made me cry. We arrived at 4am to be shown to our room which was all very nice. In the morning whilst taking a stroll around the site we noticed a very small sign (the only sign) that had been placed by the pool. The sign stated that the pool was going to close for renovations that evening and remain closed for 9 days. We were due to stay 10. When we booked our honeymoon we expected to have full use of the pool as well as the beach. We did not expect the whole hotel to be stuck on the very small patch of private beach having no refreshing pool to dive into. As we had saved for over a year to pay for this holiday we were understandably disappointed. We complained to the reception staff and then the manager whose explanation was that they can't help the pool requiring a renovation. I was furious and very upset. The hotel rep initially was uncontactable. The reception staff told us the problem was with our travel agent in the UK. As the pool was in Dubai as were we, we couldn't understand his logic. The travel agents claimed they never received any notifiaction about the closure. After 1 and a half days of our honeymoon being wasted on basically sitting on the reception (as they refused to speak to us) the rep finally gained approval from the travel agent to move us to the Hilton down the beach. The Hilton was fantastic. Stay there, not here. Additionally we booked Half board but on our first evening were given a bill for dinner. The half board only included £20 worth of dinner for some reason and there was no warning of this either. I would have marked the service as a zero, but you have to mark at least 1 on this sight.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable break”
Reviews.Author: ragpop
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Dubai, but probably wont be our last. We arrived early at the Sheraton and our room wasnt ready, however the desk offered us an room upgrade free of charge, but as it was inland view we didnt bother and waited for our room to become available. Worth the wait , pleasant room and always immaculately cleaned. As for the hotel, yes I agree the prices for drinks are expensive, i think a bottle of wine was about £40 also we paid about £8 for a beer and some water. We also visited the Hilton on a couple of occassions for drinks and for a mojito and a guinness it cost £18.If you drink a lot of water and are on a budget, then I would suggest that you purchase it outside of the hotel. This isnt an all inclusive hotel, so dont expect free water. Taxis are cheap if you get the normal ones. We liked the location of this hotel as it was at the end of the Walk so was pleasant to stroll out for our evening meal (La Dolce Vita and Indian Palace served good food, reasonably priced as well). Yes the hotel is next to a construction site (the Marina)didnt bother us at all, but bearing in mind the amount of construction in Dubai, not a problem. If you dont want to see construction sites then dont come to Dubai as it is a work in progress. Traffice can get quite congested at times if you are moving across the city, this is due to the ongoing roadworks. Afternoon tea at the Burj Al Arab was fun and you felt like royalty. Didnt come across any bad or surly waiters as others seem to have, everybody was very pleasant, polite and helpful. As for the malls - I would also agree that the prices are more expensive than here although that is based on one visit to the Emirates mall. This was the only place where I thought that the shop staff were too pushy! Nice touch of the hotel to send up a cake for my birthday. We too have travelled extensively and found our stay there quite relaxing, yes we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A con hotel”
Reviews.Author: AhKwa
Reviews.Content: I don't want to be long winded here but the experience we had as a group of 19 people is unanimously TERRIBLE. We all feel deceived when we were not granted the Starwood points and count of nights without being informed prior to entering into contract. We chose the hotel solely because of the loyalty program as we were actually offered cheaper rates at newer and more posh hotels. Our dissatisfaction doesn't stop there. Throughout our one month stays, we were given rude and unhelpful front desk and guest service. Example, a few of us had our free internet connections expired within 2 weeks of stay and requested for it to be renewed. The front desk and guest service did not get a simple task done, in fact, wasted almost half of our day coming back and forth the counter to check on the status (obviously, they promised to get back to us everytime we were there). As I don't want to be long-winded, I hope this example can show you how bad are they in serving the customers. For Starwood preferred guests, you better fight for your privileges as it is not given to you even if you asked. We, being at least Gold status guests, fought for so long during check in just to get into preferred floors. Also, for those who is going in through group bookings, be very careful with the sales and marketing staff. They are all unhelpful cons. When you faced problems pertaining to what was contracted, they will show up and give you promises that it will be settled but there will be no news from them after that, i.e., no follow up at all. That happened to the internet connection renewal I've mentioned above. All in all, this hotel is lacking communications among all the departments or even the staff. We wasted a lot of time and were frustrated for many times just because they don't communicate with each other. Don't ever go to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another bad Sheraton experience”
Reviews.Author: Yogi_Bear_NZ
Reviews.Content: Turned up to find that they didnt have the seaview room we had booked, instead was put into a smelly room with a view over a building site. Awful. The chap at reception was very courteous about it though, and offered to get us a seaview room for our 2nd night. Which they did. Not a very organised outfit, and some of the reception staff were pretty bored in their service. Tried to charge me for a limousine service I didnt even use, and then grudgingly took it off my bill. Considering the standard of other hotels in Dubai, this one's pretty poor. However the location next to the beach is fantastic and the beach really is quite nice, although water was REALLY warm considering it was 47 degrees outside! Not a terrible hotel, but not what I'd expect from a Sheraton.....the name doesnt mean much anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: OttDubai
Reviews.Content: We are residence of JBR and use the hotels facilities often till resent. After the management change at this hotel the service collapsed. On one occasion we saw the new Lebanese GM Mr. Dager shouting and abusing staff in the middle of the lobby, no wonder the service suffers. When I asked one of the waiters why he is so sad looking he told me his shift is for 12 hours without overtime payment and the staff diner is reduced as well. It was confirmed by many of the staff. We don’t support slavery and will not visit any Sheraton anymore! Helga Ott

Reviews.Title: “never stay there”
Reviews.Author: SilviaR_9
Reviews.Content: My stay there just a month ago was petty much pathetic. there is ongoing building site next to the hotel, the staff is rude and not qualified , the conditions barevly meet the expectations of 2 or max 3 star hotel. never go there

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as you would expect in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: mattp1874
